results.description:
PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try a "NEW" FUN and different Calorie torching work out!!!


645am-715am - Pound Rock Out Work out - total body

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks, Dragon push ups, hand walks, etc... so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

WHY POUND? in shape magazine April 21 http://www.shape.com/fitness/workouts/15-next-big-fitness-trends

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™

What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories

IT WORKS.

POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it

I am offering 2 weeks free

please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com 

 facebook: CatGarloFitness and see some reviews. Photos and invites on here as well.

https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness

results.description:
BNI Chapter 17 – Referrals in Motion

We invite you to visit our weekly networking meeting, and let us help you grow your business. Every Thursday, we meet to develop our business relationships; and every day we work together to bring quality referrals and new business to our colleagues in Chapter 17.

Chapter 17 meets every Thursday morning from 7:00am to 8:30am at Hunt & Fish Club, 125 W 44th St, New York, NY.

Breakfast is FREE for visitors.

Please bring 50+ business cards to pass to everyone in the room and be prepared to tell the room who you are, what you do and who a perfect referral for you would be. Be specific!

BNI is unique in that membership is limited to one professional per profession - meaning that each one of our members locks out the competition by representing a specific category of business.  Email with questions or for more information.

You will meet quality professionals in these industries: CPA, business coach, voice/data/security, mortgage banker/broker, office machines, photographer, acupuncture, executive recruiting, payroll services, architect, residential real estate, health/life/disability insurance, computer consulting, title insurance, chiropractor, trust & estate attorney, real estate attorney, background screening, foreign currency exchange, financial advisor, property & casualty insurance, bookkeeping, graphic design, business/career strategic advisor, art dealer/advisor, office furniture, commercial real estate, business attorney, personal injury attorney and catering/Asian restaurant.

Desired Member Categories Event Planner

• IT support and consulting

• Business Banker

• Personal Trainer

• Travel Agent

• Florist

• Massage Therapist

• Printing Services

• Dentist

• Matrimonial Attorney

• Immigration Attorney

• and many more!
results.name: BNI Ch 17 Weekly Thursday Meeting

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

Most Thursdays (except when there is a holiday) from 8:15-9:30AM we conduct our networking and business development meetings for salespeople, consultants, entrepreneurs and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2015 @AXA: 8:15-10AM
Thursdays @AXA, Citrin Cooperman and O'Lunney's

July 9 & Lunch, 16 & Happy Hr, 23 & Lunch

We are much more than your average networking group. We act as your own private business advisory council. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is a breakfast business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.)
16th floor (Always check with security)

Raphi Salem

results.description:
Being the change you wish to teach is the most effective way to model permaculture for children. Over this two-day workshop, we will explore skills and practices that can be applied in a multi-faceted way to​ your work as an educator. This workshop is​ designed for parents, teachers and mentors of children ranging in age from early childhood to high school students. You’ll learn ​how to integrate permaculture ethics and principles into your school, classroom, community, curriculum and teaching designs. The workshop delves into the following ethos that is essential in contemporary education:​ I am curious to learn about how our relationship with nature’s patterns weaves people and places toward global healing.

​This workshop is almost entirely hands-on and experiential. Games, movement, and observation will be used to explore the topic of designing regenerative educational systems through the following tools:

   Childhood Passions​ ​as Tools for Learning
   The Responsibility of Diversity    
   A Permaculture Classroom Model 
   Mentorship as a Basis for Classroom Management
   Place-making for Community Support
   Zone Zero: The Center of the Educational Initiative

Click for more info.
results.how_to_find_us: www.beyondorganicdesign.com
results.name: IPEC: Teaching Permaculture to Children Not Just Gardening APPLICATION EXTENDED!

QuickBooks is the most popular software for small businesses. You can start to get an understanding of how it works and what it can do for your business.

The instructor will be an Advanced Certified QuickBooks ProAdvisor Consultant and Trainer with Presti & Naegele.

Description & Speaker Summary

 Linux is the foundation for many recent innovations in IT, networking and SDN. As part of the NPUG Linux 101 series, this session will cover the basics of host kernel networking including how to configure and troubleshoot networks in a Linux OS environment.  Our speaker, Travis Bonfigli has been in the UNIX/Linux and networking world since 1990 and holds several industry certifications including, CCNP (R&S/Wireless), CCNA (R&S/Wireless), CWNE #131, and is a Cisco Networking Academy Certified Instructor.  Travis has been teaching UNIX/Linux and Cisco networking at Anne Arundel Community College in Arnold, Maryland since the fall of 1999 and loves being a Technology Evangelist.  Travis is currently the Senior Network Architect at Acentia where he supports the National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) Environmental Satellite Processing Center enterprise network environment around the globe.

results.description:
Hey JJ Jazzers,

Let's Get Social @ The Lex!

It is a lovely hang, no cover or minimum.

As a brand new meet-up, we will not only be getting members free or discounted access to jazz & blues shows and events around the city but also hosting musical happy hour socials to give us a chance to get to know one another and enjoy music at the same time. On Thursday July 9th we will be hosting our first after work Happy Hour Social at The Lexington Hotel in Midtown NYC.

Jazz Vocalist Vicki Burns will be performing a duo set with the extremely talented guitar virtuoso Ron Affif!

We'll meet at 5pm for a cocktail at the bar for a meet and greet. Vicki & Ron will be playing their jazz set from  6:00pm - 8:00pm. We will be meeting in the Mixing Room Bar off the lobby of the Hotel.

The Mixing Room celebrates the Lexington New York City’s jazz age heritage Tuesday through Saturday evenings from 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM with live music. These weekly performances include themes such as The Great American Songbook Revisited, Bebop and Beyond, and Modern Jazz Night.

Here are links with more info:

https://www.facebook.com/events/630852930385181/

http://www.lexingtonhotelnyc.com/dine/mixing-room

Come on by, bring a friend and let's get Social!

See You at The Lex!

MORE ABOUT THE HOTEL:

The Mixing Room seating areas are outfitted in a fusion of modern, classic and 1920s-inspired furnishings. The room’s rich color palette and eclectic textures hint at contemporary design influences among the hotel’s Art Deco legacy. The Lexington New York City’s art collection, curated by Paige Powell and anchored by works of Alba Clemente and Ruben Toledo, flows into the bar area and dresses the walls. An anthology of jazz melodies dance in the air and play tribute to the hotel’s past and present.

Presenting seasonal cocktails with fresh juices and garnishes, as well as classic concoctions with a twist, highlights of The Mixing Room’s menu include The Fitzgerald with rum, Maraschino, fresh grapefruit juice, fresh lime and a grapefruit twist garnish; The Gimlet with vodka or gin, fresh lime juice, honey syrup and a splash of orange blossom water; The Sidewinder with Cognac, fresh lemon, Cointreau and a raw sugar rim; and The Mr. Lex Martini with vodka or gin, vermouth and a blue cheese stuffed olive. Patrons can order delectable appetizers with an Asian Flare off of The Mixing Room menu to top off the evening.
results.how_to_find_us: Come through the front door of the Hotel and the Mixing Room is directly to the left and the music will be right in front.

This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests/Mastermind (45 minutes)

6:30-7:00pm – Connection exchange (30 minutes – or longer, as space availability allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

A gem found atop midtown west's skyline. The Attic Rooftop & Lounge is New York City's newest nightlife and after work hotspot.

The 5,000 square foot bi-level space is located on the penthouse of the Hilton Garden Hotel, boosting indoor and outdoor space. The space is designed and has taken its inspiration from the golden era of Hollywood. The rooftop celebrates the bold patterns and relaxed environment of Beverly Hills pool lounges and outdoor gardens while the penthouse lounge, with floor to ceiling glass windows, is inspired by the robust architecture of Richard Neutra and the past contemporary Hollywood Hills vernoculor. It's a cozy lounge with a sunken living room feel. The color palette is silver and grey with warm woods. Large bars on each level, plush seating, bi-level DJ booths with state of the art sound system and multiple screens integrated into the design for corporate branding and event branding are some highlights of the space. results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Kickball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
TITLE: Social Justice and a More Socialized Democracy

FORMAT: We order from the menu and socialize. We begin our program by 7:00 PM.

TOPIC: The kick-off for this discussion will be delivered by Beth K. Lamont, the widow of Corliss Lamont, who was, himself, a staunch advocate of a more Socialized Democracy. He was a Champion of Civil Liberties, and the author of "The Philosophy Of Humanism". The discussion will address the need for Social Justice in this country, and will look at the positions of advocates like Bernie Sanders and other public figures. Various proponents and supporters are invited to join the discussion. All points of view are welcome. Come meet with other Humanists for what will surely be an interesting conversation, and tell about your own perspective, and share with others your own vision for our Democracy.

ADMISSION: Free, but annual HSMNY chapter membership ($25.00 singles / $35.00 couples) is encouraged.

Note: This HSMNY Chapter Meeting Announcement Notice can be found on the HSMNY Web site at http://bit.ly/1CoIT1x.

results.name: Social Justice and a More Socialized Democracy

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE DON'T HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Joe A.)

(Co-leader- JP)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Learn with our NYC Data Science Program (We've offered corporate and individual training to more than 40 firms in NYC alone). We offer 12 week immersive program, weekend and weekday night Data Science training.

Join the open house to learn more about our 12-Week Data Science bootcamp. (Apply before Deadline May 6th.)

Come to check out our new campus and bootcamp classroom.

====================================

The Founder of the school, Vivian Zhang, along with the COO, Janet Kamin, will be hosting. 

You're Invited! Save the date. Come have an after-work drink with members of the NYC Data Science community. Learn how you can bring your data scientist goals to life.

Drop in any time between 6:00 - 8:00 pm!

Meet our instructors, alumni, and staff. Learn what it means to be a Data Science student, and check out our alumni's final projects. Manhattan Toastmasters' General Meeting is scheduled for Thursday, July 9, 2015. We would like to welcome guests to attend this meeting. You will get to experience awesome speeches by our Manhattan Toastmasters Club members as well gain some experience speaking in front of a group. 

Our meetings are divided into three sections. The first section is project speeches, delivered by our Club Members. The second section is Table Topics, where Club Members and Guests get a chance to practice impromptu speaking. Third and final section are Evaluations when the project speakers receive constructive feedback from the evaluators. 

Come and join us for our General meeting and take the first step in improving your public speaking skills, gain confidence and make new friends who will support and encourage you.

results.description:
A gem found atop midtown west's skyline. The Attic Rooftop & Lounge is New York City's newest nightlife and after work hotspot.

The 5,000 square foot bi-level space is located on the penthouse of the Hilton Garden Hotel, boosting indoor and outdoor space. The space is designed and has taken its inspiration from the golden era of Hollywood. The rooftop celebrates the bold patterns and relaxed environment of Beverly Hills pool lounges and outdoor gardens while the penthouse lounge, with floor to ceiling glass windows, is inspired by the robust architecture of Richard Neutra and the past contemporary Hollywood Hills vernoculor. It's a cozy lounge with a sunken living room feel. The color palette is silver and grey with warm woods. Large bars on each level, plush seating, bi-level DJ booths with state of the art sound system and multiple screens integrated into the design for corporate branding and event branding are some highlights of the space. Check out more here

Date/Time: July 9th Thursday 6:00 PM - 10:00 PM

Cost: FREE admission for all; Must mention Jack for FREE admission. 

How to get there (Hopstop): https://www.hopstop.com/search?xfr=cityscape

Strict Dress Code: No sneakers or boots for guys & shirt is required; ladies dress sexy & high heel is required. Entry is at the doorman's discretion. 

21+ with government issued ID

Official Site: http://www.theattic-nyc.com/
results.name: July Happy Hours @ Attic Rooftop - FREE Admission

results.description:
Non-Enterprise Customers Unite : Features YOU can use in SQL Server 2014/2016

For the current and next versions of SQL Server, there is no end to information about the enhancements to Availability Groups, Columnstore indexes, In-Memory OLTP (“Hekaton”), and Operational Analytics. But if you’re not running Enterprise Edition, what’s in it for you? In this session you’ll learn about a variety of features and enhancements that are available in Standard (or any) Edition of SQL Server 2014 and 2016, and how they will make your job easier and your databases faster. The presentation will be delivered by Aaron Bertrand (SQL Server MVP) and the meeting will be sponsored by SQL Sentry.

Name and address

results.description:
We are pleased to welcome Nathaniel Popper to Bitcoin Center NYC for a book signing event. Bring your copy to have it signed by the author!

"Digital Gold" is a new book that tells the story of Bitcoin's invention and eventual rise to today. 

Nathaniel Popper reports on Wall Street for the New York Times.

More info: http://techcrunch.com/2015/05/31/an-interview-with-nathaniel-popper-author-of-digital-gold/

-----

As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.


Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Monday & Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Trading Pit aka

‘The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares’

Bitcoin Center NYC

40 Broad Street

New York, NY 10004


For a map of Bitcoin Center NYC, click here. 

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].

results.description:
*** Multi-group meetup ***


It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Fast night hike.  6 ish miles (been known to reach 7.33 ;-), with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 6:15pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 2.5 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake then decide if we take the white trail that leads us to some great views of the sunset and NYC.  We can walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a> and decide our descent and length of the hike from here.  Most likely we'll take the white to yellow and back to blue and out. This route will change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

You’re invited to join HelloDotNYC, WeWork and CoInvent for a digital marketing seminar focused on Hyperlocal marketing on July 9th. The topics for this seminar include, but not limited to, Hyperlocal Marketing, Hyperlocalizing SEO, .NYC Domains, etc. Drinks and refreshments are included.

Want to sell in New York? Go Local, wait, Go Hyperlocal.

This free event is made possible by our partners at HelloDotNYC and WeWork. For members in CoInvent community, all .NYC domain names at https://www.hellodotnyc.com/ are now 50% off for the 1st year of registration.

Agenda

6:15 PM - 6:30 PM - Registration

6:30 PM - 7:15 PM - Panel

7:15 PM - 8:30 PM - Networking

Panel

• David Hirschman -Co-founder & COO @ Street Fight (@davehirschman)

• Joe Apfelbaum - Co-Founder & CEO @ Ajax Union (@joeapfelbaum)


• Kevin Lee - Founder &  CEO   @ Didit.com (@Kevin_Lee_QED)


• Sean Barkulis - Director, Strategic Partnerships @ ShopKeep (@SeanBarkulis)

• Claudio Schapsis - Founder @ Georillas (@schapsis)

David Hirschman, Co-founder & COO @ Street Fight 

David has worked in online media for a decade and a half. He previously was news editor at Mediabistro, online editor at Editor & Publisher, and a reporter for Metro NY. He has also written and edited for Wired, The New York Times, Ad Age, Forbes Traveler, New York magazine and many other online and offline publications. He lives in Providence, Rhode Island. 


Joe Apfelbaum - CEO & Co-Founder @ Ajax Union

Joe is the CEO and co-founder of digital marketing agency, Ajax Union. He is a public speaker, certified Google Trainer, and published business author. Joe enjoys speaking and writing about a broad range of business topics in his seminars, webinars and articles. Joe is a member of the Board of Directors of the Entrepreneurs Organization in NY, a group with over 10,000 CEO’s. Joe is a trusted advisor for the Vistage community of 18,000 CEO’s and a contributing member of the INC Business Owners Council, a community of the fastest growing companies in the United States.


Kevin Lee - Founder & CEO @ Didit.com


Kevin Lee is CEO of Didit.com a leading digital marketing firm and founder of We-Care.com which has generated over $8 million for nonprofits through cause marketing. With 21 years of digital marketing experience, 4 books, over 545 speaking engagements, and over 780 columns in trade publications, Kevin Lee, Didit CEO is clearly a leading Digital Marketing pioneer. As an industry thought-leader, founding member of the SEMPO.org board and current eMarketing Association board member, Kevin educates marketers on the benefits of a unified digital strategy that encompasses SEO, Social, Content, Advertising and other forms of digital media. Kevin’s passion for digital marketing is contagious. Since founding Didit in 1996, Kevin is proud to have a team that has grown Didit into leading digital agency through several acquisitions and organic growth to the point where the team handles a diverse set of clients across industries from the Fortune 500 to startups and mid-sized businesses.

Kevin is the inventor of the technologies Didit uses to assure client success as well as We-Care.com’s platforms including Sweeps4aCause.com a conversion enhancement system for marketers that improves effectiveness of marketing campaigns while simultaneously helping nonprofits.Kevin earned his Yale MBA in 1992.


Sean Barkulis - Director, Strategic Partnerships @ ShopKeep


Sean Barkulis is currently Director of Strategic Partnerships at ShopKeep, a cloud-based Point of Sale solution for local businesses. He has also consulted, advised and launched several hyperlocal and financial technology platforms serving SMBs. You can follow him on twitter @SeanBarkulis


Claudio Schapsis - Founder @ Georillas<a href="http://www.ripleysnewyork.com/"></a>


Claudio Schapsis is the former Chief eXperience Officer and Marketing director of Ripley’s believe it or Not, Times Square and founder of Georillas, a strategic mobile/hyper-local marketing group that works with businesses, agencies, and CMOs to implement mobile and location-based strategies into their marketing mix. His customers range from multi-local chains (i.e. Subway Argentina), multi-stores places (i.e. Grand Central Terminal), and diverse sole location businesses in different vertical.

Schapsis also advises start-ups in Location Services projects, Indoor Navigation, Mapping, and others.

He is a frequent speaker on mobile/location based marketing topics. He has given keynote and general session presentations at more than 20 events and institutions like Fordham, Pace, and Columbia University.

Schapsis serves as member on the Board of Directors of MENG, a national organization of over 1,500 top-level marketing executives, and Creative Art Works, a non-profit that improves the lives of under-resourced kids in Upper-Manhattan through the arts.

results.description:
So it's time for a do-over. PLEASE REMEMBER TO RSVP ON THE MEETUP GROUP PAGE!


There are many issues on the agenda to discuss.

The Charleston shooting is still hot on the minds of everyone. Black Christian- church bombings often by self-proclaimed Christians like the Ku Klux Klan- were common during the tumultuous Civil Rights fights of the 1950s and 1960s. Hopefully the massacre at a black church in Charleston by an apparent lone wolf White Supremacist is not the beginning of a trend, but we need to discuss the incident, and what might be motivating someone to do this in this day and age. What motivates people to become White Supremacists (which is their constitutional right) in the first place? And what motivated this lone White Supremacist to commit such a brutal massacre against a peaceful prayer group that had invited him to pray with them? How do we counter the White Supremacist mindset?

Also on the agenda is the apparent police militarization of our hospitals triggered by a recent trip to the emergency room at Richmond University Medical Center. Why is there is a need for 20 cops, a mini-police precinct, in a hospital emergency room filled with bed-ridden sick people? Why are our hospitals now turned into prisons? Why are hospital patients treated like prisoners (or worse than prisoners, at least prisoners get a phone call)? Do you know to assert your rights when a hospital attempts to detain you against your will?

We are also looking to brainstorm for strategies for engagement with the outside and interact with the communities of Staten Island. Addressing black apathy on the North Shore toward political issues and turning out to vote is obviously of prime concern. Why are African-American Staten Islanders seemingly so apathetic when it comes to getting politically involved to confront issues that affect their communities. But Staten Island is majority white, how do we reach out to communities all across Staten Island, where many white people are simply ignorant as to the problems that plague their own island? This group is about uniting Staten Island against racism, police brutality, economic and social injustice, and asserting rights, liberty, and yes, social justice for ALL. None of the major civil rights battles would have been won without getting the white majority to see the errors of their ways. Getting a white congress and white president to pass the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and Voting Rights Act of 1965, getting an all-white Supreme Court to strike down school segregation and bans on interracial marriage. This should not just be a battle to get black voters to turn out in enough numbers to outvote the rest of the island as if Staten Islanders were divided against each other. Obviously that would be a losing strategy because even if every black voter turned out, there is still a white majority. From North Shore to South Shore, we need to learn how to interact with communities of all sorts and try to get people on our side.


To quote Chris Rock: "There have been smart, educated, beautiful, polite black children for hundreds of years. The advantage that my children have is that my children are encountering the nicest white people that America has ever produced. Let’s hope America keeps producing nicer white people."

How do we get white Staten Islanders to be nicer white people? :P 

Also, we lost one major battle with regard to the Trans-Pacific Partnership "trade deal" that would destroy American jobs (and send them to Vietnam where workers are paid 60 cents an hour), establish draconian intellectual property laws that would affect internet freedom as well as send the costs of medication skyrocketing. The TPP also threatens labor regulations, environmental regulations, and financial regulations. Congress passed Fast Track Trade Promotion Authority (TPA). A smiling President Obama signed it today. This means the president now has total power to negotiate the whole deal in secret, and Congress will not have any opportunity to amend it any way. However all hope is not lost. The TPP itself still needs to pass both Houses of Congress. Thanks to Fast Track, Congress will be presented with the entire shit sandwich that is the TPP, negotiated entirely in secret between Obama and major international corporations, and will simply have an up-or-down vote on it. We need to get Congress to give it a clear DOWN vote! 

This is not a one-issue group obviously, if anyone has any other ideas feel free to let me know! 

And yes, Flagship Brewery is open on Thursdays!


Otherwise I look forward to seeing you all again! :)
results.name: Charleston Massacre,Hospital Prisons, the TPP, Strategies for Engagement

results.description:
The Brooklyn Historical Society has a series called "Hidden Brooklyn", and in one installation, they go to our local army base,  Fort Hamilton!   I haven't been here in donkey's years, for my cousin's wedding reception at the Officers Club, it was called then. Really looking forward to learning more about Fort Hamilton!

Here's the description from the Brooklyn Historical Society website:  "Explore the Harbor Defense Museum and historic Fort Hamilton as we travel to the foot of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge for an evening of viewing exhibits and taking in the views! Tour goers are invited to stay on and purchase dinner at the Ft. Hamilton Community Club with its stunning view of The Narrows. *Please note that this is an off-site tour. Exact meeting location for the tour is included in the confirmation email upon purchasing tickets to this event. Tickets must be purchased in advance. Tickets will not be sold at the door.* "     


So, that's  why I'm not listing a meeting place here yet, because you have to purchase the tickets ahead of time.   Go to the website for the BHS and scroll down for this July 9th event--the link to order the tickets is there: http://www.brooklynhistory.org/visitor/calendar.html


Cost:  $15/$10 for BHS Members.  There is also our own $1 meetup fee, payable to the Meetup organizer, me.

How to meet us: We're meeting at 6:15pm for this 6:30pm event  at the location you receive when you buy your tickets. 

I will be holding a handwritten sign that says MEETUP.

Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 

Specials for our meetup:

• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Thursday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm

REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140
Learn to Climb 1-Month Package // $149
10-Visit Pass // $250
Memberships // Click for details

*Full-time college student ages 18-25

RENTALS

Climbing Shoes // $6
Harness // $5
Chalk Bag // $3
Package // $12

Click Here for details on memberships.

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.

If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

More info: http://lic.thecliffsclimbing.com/

Guess what dweebo? We've got another free pre-release screaming for you! Come see the fact-based shocker ALLELUIA, the new film from Fabrice Du Welz, acclaimed Belgian director of Euro thrillers CALVAIRE and VINYAN.

ALLELUIA draws its inspiration from the notorious Honeymoon Killers case that has enthralled true crime buffs for decades. To get tickets, send an email to [masked]. You must list 'ALLELUIA' as your subject line and give us your full name. Your ticket is good for you and one guest. Names will be checked at the door. Seating is Not guaranteed, so get to the theatre EARLY!  The film begins promptly at 7pm.

This exclusive event is hosted by our friends at FANGORIA, and presented by their pals from Music Box Films, who release the award-winning ALLELUIA to VOD and theaters on July 17th.


Here's the official synopsis for ALLELUIA:

Based on infamous real-life "lonely hearts killers" who made victims of their romantic liaisons, ALLELUIA is a dark and fascinating love-story-gone-wrong. Michel (Laurent Lucas, WITH A FRIEND LIKE HARRY and CALVAIRE) is a born womanizer and professional hustler with a penchant for wooing friendless, vulnerable widows and divorcees. When he meets introverted single mom Gloria (Lola Dueñas, VOLVER) online and treats her to an electrifying first date, she's left completely smitten.

Michel tries to swindle what he can out of the one-night stand, but his latest victim has other plans. Basking in the rush of new love, she frantically pursues him, witnessing the true depths of his depravity and offering herself as an accomplice in his seductive crimes. Having truly met their match in each other, the unhinged lovers embark on a deadly odyssey amplified by wild sex, unbridled jealousy and passionate forays into the dark arts. This smart and gory shocker breathes new life into the lovesick horror genre to serve up a chilling tale of white-hot desperation and terrifying devotion.

Here's what the critics screamed about ALLELUIA:

"A gripping and poetic study of toxic co-dependency"
-- Robert Everett-Gordon, GLOBE & MAIL

"Sends its audience down a rabbit hole of obsession…enthralling. Shocking. Once ALLELUIA grabs you, it doesn’t let go."
-- Ryan Turek, Shock Till You Drop

"A fire-charged thriller that spins a disturbing web of madness, jealousy, sex and murder."
-- Shelagh Rowan-Legg, Twitch

So ya'all, mark your calendars to praise </a><a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3218580/">ALLELUIA yourselves on July 9th, and expect a few cool giveaways from Fangoria! Our buddy and Fango editor emeritus Tony Timpone will be hosting the show. This is one you don’t wanna miss!!


https://youtu.be/GWSeqpU8Evc
results.name: FREE Screaming of the new Horror Thriller, 'ALLELUIA', hosted by Fangoria!!

Inner Engineering is a method, a tool to engineer a deep and lasting personal transformation. It is a combination of methods and technologies derived from the ancient science of yoga. It is a comprehensive system addressing every aspect of human well-being – from body, mind and emotion to the fundamental life energy within us.

Over two million people have completed the “Inner Engineering” program worldwide and have reported remarkable results. The program includes engaging discourses exploring the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life situations, along with guided meditations, group discussions, simple yoga postures, and a powerful and purifying energy technique designed to bring one’s entire system into alignment and harmony.

Shambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony. 

Benefits:

*Relief from chronic ailments 
*Improved mental clarity, sleep quality, and increased energy levels 
*Ability to handle stressful situations effortlessly 
*Deepening of interpersonal relationships, thus cultivating a greater sense of connectivity at home, work and in the community 
*Helps to purify the five elements (earth, water, fire, air, space) in the body leading to pleasantness in the body, mind and emotion 
*Access to the intelligence and competence within, which is the very source of creation 
*Greater peace and joy in everyday life.

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

Investing.

and Flips and passive wealth with rental properties.

results.description:
The goal of the Latin America Tech Meetup is to bring members of tech community, including noted entrepreneurs and investors, to discuss trends and opportunities in the convergence of startups, technology and Latin America.

Our Special Guests

Jake Schwartz (Co-founder CEO General Assembly), started GA with 3 friends in 2011. Prior to founding General Assembly, Jake worked for Associated Partners, a private equity firm. He countsith a B.A. in American studies from Yale University and an MBA from Wharton. General Assembly has scaled to nine cities (in the US, Asia, and Europe) in less than three years, working with more than 70,000 students and employing 300 people; he has raised over $45 million to date.

_______________________________________________________________________

Omar Téllez (Moovit first President, TechCrunch Contributor) - He sits on Moovit’s  (public transit mapping funded by Sequoia) and Solomoto’s advisory boards. Prior to that he was part of the Synchronoss Technologies, Inc., executive team (NASDAQ: SNCR ; Best software IPO of 2006). His views on LATAM can be seen in these two TechCrunch articles: Producing Unicorns In The Land Of Fútbol, Samba And El Dorado, Understanding Tech Penetration In Latin America. He can be followed @ohtellez


Agenda

6:30 Drinks & Food

7:00 Omar Téllez (Moovit President, TechCrunch Contributor)

7:15 Jake Schwartz (Co-founder CEO General Assembly)

8:00 Networking

Hosts

Adrian Avendano, founder of the Latin America Tech Meetup in NYC and SF and CEO of Peoplehunt. Adrian was born in Mexico City, raised in New York City, and has lived in Chile, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Denmark, UK, and San Francisco. His obsession is making things that change the world. He started his fist company in Ireland in 2008. Since then he has been startingtech companies that connect people face to face.Yahoo bio press http://yhoo.it/1kx3yqc


Felipe Saenz was born in Colombia, grew up in Miami, and is now based in New York. Felipe is the Founder & CEO of a music startup and co-organizer of the LatAm Tech Meetup. The music startup is a platform that digitizes the middle man for musicians and later on for any type of digital content creator. Some backers uncluding a University part of Berklee's College of Music. Felipe has also gathered his team of five, to make his startup a reality.


<a href="http://moovitapp.com/"></a> Special thanks to our proud sponsor:
results.name: Fire Side Chat with Jake Schwartz Co-founder/CEO of General Assembly

results.description:
Are you a “Shark” in your profession? Looking to spruce up your corporate closet? Take a dive into the deep end with fellow RE professionals and join us at Elevee Luxury Clothiers for a night of networking, cocktails, and fashion. 

Take a dive into the deep end with fellow RE professionals and join us at Elevee Luxury Clothiers for a night of networking, cocktails, and fashion. 

PropertyShark invites professionals from the Real Estate, Legal and other affiliated industries  for a beneficial and enjoyable evening composed of mingling with fellow professional “sharks” and clients, as well as learning how to take your sharp look to the next level.

CEO of FashionsGuyNY and FashionWeekOnline.com NY Senior Director of Editorial Chris Collie will personally provide you with Men’s Fashion style & trends. He will be breaking down the wardrobe of a shark from suits/blazers/pants to accessories to scents to footwear.

All guests will enjoy complimentary Open Bar & gourmet desserts from Pi Bakerie in Soho. Music by DJ Paulie Pop.

YOUR NIGHT AT A GLANCE

• Styling Consultations to update your professional wardrobe

• Custom suiting measurements

• Mulitple networking opportunities with over 10 diverse industries

• Complimentary access to Elevee’s Robo Golf Pro

• 20% off Eventsy Premium Memberships

• Eventsy Hosts personally connecting you to like-minded professionals

• 15% off PropertyShark Subscriptions

• Professional Photographers – Dress to Impress!

FREE ADMISSION for PropertyShark subscribers & Eventsy Premium Members - email info@eventsy for your ticket access code. 

If you are not a member and are interested in attending please contact [masked]

ABOUT ELEVEE

Elevee’s hand tailored, custom wardrobes are designed exclusively to fit each client’s lifestyle from causal to formal. Elevee infuses the expertise of our design team, the craftsmanship of our Master Tailors and the finest fabrics in the world with your personal style and comfort level in mind. We understand the impact of being impeccably dressed and the necessity to establish each client’s own unique image and brand. Elevee’s old world approach and new age design offers a distinct look that redefines style.

ABOUT PROPERTY SHARK

Founded in 2003 by real estate investor and programmer Matthew Haines as a property research tool, and acquired by Yardi Systems Inc in 2010, PropertyShark.com has gradually developed into the must-have tool for real estate professionals – ranging from commercial and residential brokers and agent teams, investors, developers, appraisers, lenders and homebuyers in New York, and other major US markets across the country. PropertyShark.com has a team of over 100 dedicated employees constantly working to ensure that the available data is accurate and up-to-date.

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Joel Spolsky, Stack Exchange

Joel Spolsky is the founder and CEO of Stack Exchange, a network of 127 question and answer websites including Stack Overflow, the #1 site for developers to ask and answer programming questions.

Joel is a globally recognized expert on software development and is known by developers around the world for his website Joel on Software. In 2000, he founded his first company, Fog Creek Software, which creates project management tools for software developers, including Trello, which recently spun out into its own company.

Previously, Joel worked at Microsoft, where he designed VBA as a member of the Excel team, and at Juno Online Services, where he developed an Internet client used by millions. He has written three books, including Smart and Gets Things Done: Joel Spolsky’s Concise Guide to Finding the Best Technical Talent (Apress, 2007) and worked as a contributing editor for Inc. magazine.

Joel graduated from Yale University with a computer science degree. Before college, he served in the Israeli Defense Forces as a paratrooper and helped found Kibbutz Hanaton.

Agenda

6:30 Networking w/ Food & Drinks 
7:00 Fireside Chat w/ Joel Spolsky
8:00 Mix & Mingle Afterparty

Hosted By Peter Crysdale, New York City Chapter Director

Peter is the Founder/CEO of StrategyHack, running marketing strategy hackathons for startups and professional marketers. He has a diverse background with 8+ years experience spanning engineering, social good and technology startups. In his spare time, he enjoys day dreaming and cross country skiing.  
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @PCrysdale

Hosted By Joshua Ness, Director of Marketing & Operations

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @jcness


Global Partners

</a> Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

results.description:
Do you use Marionette and have been thinking about contributing back to the project to make it better?

Maybe you're a noob at open source. Come and learn how to contribute to Marionette with us!

Jason Laster, core Marionette team member, will walk us through on how to get set up with the Marionette source and the Marionette Inspector repos, so you can be ready to fix a small bug or add a feature if you'd like.

Jason will demo how he would go about fixing a small bug, so you can see how it's done and how to writes tests, docs, etc.

We're purposely making this a more intimate group, so please only RSVP if you're sure you can make it.

-------------------------------------------------------

AGENDA:

• 6:45 - 7:05pm: Intro to open source contributing

• Rest of the time: Breakout exercises contributing to open source

-------------------------------------------------------

Q: What should I bring?
A: Your laptop, IDE, text editor, and all that jazz you use to code. And your curiosity, of course.

Q: Will there be food?
A: Yes!

Q: Is there any prep work that I need to do ahead of time?
A: Yes, it would be really helpful if you can do this before you show up.

Get Marionette Set Up Locally

Get Marionette Inspector Set Up Locally

results.description:
In this class we will learn how to build a financial model (i.e the income statement) for your business. 

1. What information the financial model can give you and why it is necessary to build it, though much of it is a guess.


2. Income Statement Basics: Income statement structure, the meaning of different line items, and an overview of important ratios that measure operational and financial health of the company.


3. Modeling your business: We will start with a template and each of you will adopt it to your business. 

4. Revenues and Costs: We will discuss how to model different revenue streams, and estimate relevant fixed and variable costs.


5. Assumptions / Revenue and Cost drivers: The crux of the modeling is an ability to make good assumptions. Anyone can build a mathematical formula and propagate it forward, but the output is only as good as the inputs. We will explore how to make assumptions that are justifiable and achievable, what research needs to be done in order to figure out what those assumptions need to be and what strategic decisions you need to make in order to set stage for how those assumptions, such as growth rates, will evolve. 

6. Break-even analysis - i.e identifying the point in time at which your business becomes profitable.


7. We will also discuss what aspects of your financial model are important to investors and why.

Please send a $25 payment  to [masked] via PayPal by July 8th or pay $30 at the door or same day.
results.name: Financial Model for Your Business

results.description:
Chief Inspector Armand Gamache of the Surêté du Québec and his team of investigators are called in to the scene of a suspicious death in a rural village south of Montreal. Jane Neal, a local fixture in the tiny hamlet of Three Pines, just north of the U.S. border, has been found dead in the woods. The locals are certain it's a tragic hunting accident and nothing more, but Gamache smells something foul in these remote woods, and is soon certain that Jane Neal died at the hands of someone much more sinister than a careless bowhunter.

Still Life introduces not only an engaging series hero in Inspector Gamache, who commands his forces--and this series--with integrity and quiet courage, but also a winning and talented new writer of traditional mysteries in the person of Louise Penny. (McMillan Publishers)

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at some point. If you'd like to run additional miles, you are certainly more than welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. Depending on the turnout we sometimes break off into little groups of two or three people, each of which may go at slightly different paces and/or distances. Regardless, if you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

For those who wish to stick around after the run, we may get together at (insert favorite Ridgewood hot spot here) to relax, catch up, and share some laughs. When we do this, we usually get to the restaurant between 7:30 and 7:45. If anyone cares to join us that didn't come to the run, you are certainly welcome.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me. Looking forward to seeing you on Thursday.
results.name: 4 Mile Run in Ridgewood (Wild Duck Pond)

results.description:
The visual display of quantitative information, in the form of information visualization, is critical tool in many industries that allows specialists to derive meaning, understand trends, and make important associations within large complex data sets. In this talk, participants will be introduced to the design questions and considerations involved with architecting an information visualization for complex structured data, such as one would find in the financial industry. The discussion will center around the design decision making process for an information visualization that was designed for a sales and trading platform at Goldman Sachs; ultimately, the audience can learn how information visualization can add clarity and expression to their given dataset.

Nikki Roda is interaction designer helping create trading software for the Technology Division of Goldman Sachs. Prior to working in the financial industry, she’s had the pleasure of designing bespoke software solutions for government agencies and global developmental aid organizations. She’s a passionate advocate for expanding data literacy within organizations to help inform better decision making.
results.name: Design Considerations for Effective Data Visualizations

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

"MANIFEST YOUR HUSBAND (Or Wife)"

STILL SINGLE?
No Need To Struggle, Be Upset, Or Complain About Having No Man Or Woman When The Universe Is On Your Side!

You're Invited To....

"MANIFEST YOUR HUSBAND"
(Or Wife)

The Love Guru Will Show You How! In this hour event, The Love Guru will help you clear your blocks and release your fears and take you through fun, funny, wild and a bit wacky exercises to MANIFEST YOUR HUSBAND (OR WIFE)!

Come With An Open Mind
Come Open To Trying Something New
Come Ready To Do, Do, Do!


MORE DETAILS:
The Love Guru is a Spiritual Teacher, Intuitive Heart Healer and Love Expert (She's also trained as a Marriage and Family Therapist!) -- but these events aren't your typical self help / lecture style which are quiet and sometimes a bit boring. Sure you'll have mindshifts, you'll clear and heal some blocks that have been causing you to get no where in your love life, but you'll also have fun.

This event is interactive. You'll be taking notes, yes. But you'll also be doing too.

(Also, please note, if you are offended by a Spiritual Teacher/Healer who sometimes curses, is passionate and intense, and sometimes plays hip hop music during her classes, then this event is not for you. The Love Guru is definitely a new breed of guru!)


BRING TO THE EVENT:
Come with water - this helps release and clear toxins, old energy and thoughts. We're going to be stirring up a lot of old energy here, so come with water to hydrate yourself and help in the healing process

Come with a pen and paper too. No smartphones or electronic devices. We need good old fashioned notepads with you at the event. You'll want to take notes to review later and remind yourself of key points and spiritual principles shared with you.

There will also be times when you will be journaling about your feelings and thoughts. Be open to receive and participate in the event. You won't be forced to do anything you're not comfortable with, but The Love Guru is holding the space for you at the event to MANIFEST LOVE!


AFTER THE EVENT:
It is suggested that you take it easy. No alcohol or drugs (unless prescribed by your doctor and it's a must). It's key to spend some time alone for the rest of the night and the next few days so you can process all you learned and what you are ready to let go. Drinks lots of water and eat natural if you can. Spending time in nature is key. Try not to sedate yourself with distractions (going on dates, friends) or TV. Take a few days to be with yourself and connect more deeply with your True Self and Spirit -- again, processing all that came through. The Love Guru works on different layers while you are working with her one on one and at her events, so the more you are open to receiving, the more will come through for you.


DISCLAIMER:
With all the information shared, there is also a disclaimer. The Love Guru goes into events with a certain agenda on her mind, this is what is presented here to you. But with that said, Spirit is the one who calls the shots and what was once downloaded on this page as to what will be covered, based on who signs up for the event and what your energy is calling to come through, this may change.

Be open to have a unique and transformative experience. Psychic and supernatural things are a natural occurrence in The Love Guru's world and combined with your energy at the event, something exciting always comes through.

Blaire's book, "Do You Know My Husband?® The Unexpected Journey Of How The Love Guru Found "The One" is included with your ticket! After 10 years -- and during the exact same time frame when my www.marryblaire.com went viral -- Spirit has guided me to release my book.

Your Habits, Beliefs & Behaviors are Patterns some Good, some Bad
