results.description:
This Thursday the EA-NYC group has been invited to join Agora Fund for a presentation and hands-on research session.

****

When: Thursday,  7/09 (this week!), 7 - 9 P.M.

Bring: A laptop (if participating in the second half; see below)

The first hour will be a presentation by Eva Vivalt, founder of AidGrade. Eva is an academic economist, at Stanford in the fall, and previously was a Young Professional at the World Bank. AidGrade gathers data from impact evaluations and conducts meta-analyses of the data. Eva will be sharing some of her most important lessons learned from analyzing the 600 studies in their database and from her work on impact evaluations.

The second half of this event will be practical research, focused on education. We'll be breaking into small teams of 3-4 each (bring your laptop if you're staying for this portion!). Our goal is to learn how a nonprofit's self-reported claims tend to compare against rigorous impact evaluation results (drawing from AidGrade's database). Are an NGO's claims a reasonable approximation of their actual activities and impact? Are they completely uncorrelated? What are impact evaluations missing, and are there any rules of thumb we can uncover to speed up the research process?  

The results of the evening will be used by the Agora research team to help connect donors with high impact nonprofits matching their areas of interest.
results.name: NGO Impact Evaluations and Education (Talk by Eva Vivalt + Research Session)

results.description:
For the next meetup we will have two presentations:

Cross-Compiling for Windows

Abstract: 

This talk will describe how to use open-source tools to cross-compile C code on a Mac (or any *nix system) into 64-bit Windows executable programs and shared libraries (DLLs). Topics will include basic executables, commonly-used libraries, and DLLs that can be integrated into Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Access, Powerpoint etc) via VBA.

Bio: 


Matt Wong is the founder of Guarnerix, a startup company providing solutions for managing heterogeneous data. Prior to Guarnerix, he spent a decade at JPMorgan as an investment banker in their Securitized Products Group. He has also worked as a programmer, consultant and marketing manager, is a CFA® charterholder, and holds a B.S. degree in computer science from Yale University and J.D. and M.B.A. degrees from Columbia University.


Introduction to Asynchronous Programming with Boost ASIO

Abstract:

The presentation will be an overview of Boost Asio programming using the C++03 standard.  It will focus on the components of Asio and how they interact, as well as writing correct code that is easily understandable and avoiding some of the more common pitfalls, as opposed to squeezing out every ounce of performance (although some performance-related topics will likely be involved).


Bio:

Brian Davis is a Senior Software Engineer at Ullink and a cofounder of Fairfield County Makers' Guild and Jolly Roger Labs.  He programs C++ on everything from low-latency servers to 8 bit microcontrollers, and is particularly interested in what he stubbornly calls Distributed Systems along with robots and anything to do with automating everything. 

RSVPs for the meetup will open on June 10th.
results.name: July C++ Meetup: Cross-Compiling for Windows & Boost ASIO

Each settings on your camera provides a world of potential for bettering your images. Whether you use a DSLR or a point and shoot, there are tons of tricks that you may be missing out on. Our knowledgeable instructors will guide you through all the main options that your camera has, and how and when to apply each of them based on the effect and scene that you are looking to portray.

results.description:
Know Science presents: GMOs: Engineering the Genetics of our World
by Kate Bredbenner, Graduate Fellow at the Rockefeller University

7PM at Genspace
Wine & cheese at 6:30PM

RSVP here


Know Science is a an education and advocacy organization that works to bring science to the public through talks and outreach events. Our scientists present on the most cutting edge topics in the area of research in which they specialize. We offer free talk delivered by the experts about the latest research on cancer, vaccines, HIV, neurodegeneration, drug addiction, GMOs and more. For more information or to book a talk today, visit us at KnowScience.org Kate works as a scientist at the Rockefeller University in the Laboratory of Cellular Biophysics where she studies HIV using fluorescence microscopes. She is a scientific communicator and blog editor for Know Science and an avid supporter of science outreach. She is currently involved with a variety of science outreach organizations, including the BioBus, the outreach lab at the Rockefeller University, BraiNY, and Know Science. Her goal is to make a career of talking to the public about science in a fun and informative way.

Getting information on GMOs from the internet can be a scary experience. This talk aims to explain the what, why, and how of GMOs in an unbiased, informative, and scientifically accurate way. I'll go through real-world examples of GMOs and give a scientific perspective on the upsides and downsides of the technology. Know Science talks aim to be an engaging experience specifically designed for the public to understand the science behind GMOs and allow plenty of chances to ask questions during and after the talk. Join us!
results.name: KnowScience Talk- GMOs: Engineering the Genetics of our World

results.description:
Have you always been enticed by the allure of South America? Are you hoping to explore Chile and Argentina? Then join REI and Hostelling International USA for a special travel workshop exploring the nuts and bolts of traveling through Argentina and Chile. Known for its rich diversity of landscapes, cosmopolitan cities and extraordinarily dynamic culture, Argentina and Chile have quickly become major hotspots for travelers around the world. From the Pampas to Patagonia, from Santiago to Buenos Aires, there’s a breadth of activities to consider for the week-long traveler to the avid and adventurous backpacker. 

This travel workshop will cover different itineraries, recommended accommodations, managing with currency, budget travel tips, off-the-beaten path adventures and other essential elements of exploring Argentina and Chile. Paul will dispel myths about both cultures while simultaneously get you excited to move around the region affordably and safely. The presentation will also allow room for discussions and conversations, and Paul is happy to tailor some of the workshop focus based on audience interests. We look forward to seeing you there!


==========================================

About The Presenter:

Paul Kuhne currently works for Hostelling International USA (HI USA) as their Northeast Regional Engagement Manager. Paul has spent more than five years working in the nonprofit world, and the last three years working with HI USA, helping spread the word about hostelling and providing new travelers with the resources they need to go abroad. Apart from his work in the nonprofit world, he is an avid traveler, Spanish-speaker, writing enthusiast and hip-hop fan. Paul got his start traveling in college where he studied abroad in Buenos Aires, Argentina, spending five months exploring the region and traveling around the country. 

During his time, he danced tango in Buenos Aires, walked across a glacier in Patagonia, hiked a mountain in Bariloche and rode bikes around the vineyards of Mendoza. From there, he traveled to other parts of South America too, including Venezuela and Chile, and later on, northern and southern Europe. He’s also backpacked through eastern and southern Africa, explored Hong Kong, and visited Israel, and hopes to make it to New Zealand and Australia soon. He’s exciting to deliver this travel workshop to REI members to share his deep passion for Argentina and Chile with future travelers. He currently lives in Boston, MA.
results.name: Budget Traveling to Argentina and Chile

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

 

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Happiness and the Happy Pill 7-9pm at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

results.description:
Dixon Place presents... as part of the annual HOT! Fest...
FREE... w/ no drink minimum.. tho getting a drink supports Dixon Place and its artists!

ABOUT THIS SHOW
Known for rocking out on Appalachian dulcimer, DK and the Joy Machine brings her new, multi-media show to Dixon Place for this year’s HOT! Fest. With “quirky and smart” songs (from her new album SHY ONE) she addresses all the crucial questions in life: getting the girl’s number on the A train, falling in love with feral cats, being an androgynous grrrrl, and how to love yourself harder–even when that means telling others to fuck off. Joined by special guests, including Tine Kindermann on saw, DK’s eclectic music–from Americana, anti-folk to alt-rock and acoustic punk, blend with video, spoken word and other surprises from the lesbian underground.

ABOUT THE ARTIST
DK&theJoyMachine’s new album, SHY ONE, has been described as “…intense, colorful and diverse … a novel of sorts. Dark, light, humorous & humble. ” Her “quirky and smart” songs celebrate all the crucial things in life: unrequited love, falling in love with feral cats, and treating yourself with kindness. Known for her sultry, expressive voice, well crafted songs, and genre-blending, innovative work on mountain dulcimer—plucking, strumming, bowing and “rocking out” on this trad instrument, “DK”’s music is at turns evocative, moving, playful and fun, and always real. Her first studio recording, the EP, “Love Harder,” released in January 25th, 2013, was described by VENTS magazine as “an album with heart, …beauty, and passion. In every chord, note, or string you can feel poetry, sincerity, greatness… a record to closely pay attention to and be delighted by.”
MORE INFO- doors 7pm, show 7:30pm

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

results.description:
Bar'Lees is a wine/tapas bar a few blocks away from the harbor in Mamaroneck. The owner, Colin, has curated a collection of over 300 wines from around the world, specializing in Napa and Sonoma vintages from the mid-1990's through current day. Normally, that would break the bank, but you can buy tasting portions of some very old wines (the bartender uses a needle to extract the wine, and then the cork seals itself, preserving the wine).

Bar'Lees also stocks over 100 types of whiskeys from Scotland, the U.S., Australia, Canada, and more. Whether you enjoy smoky, light, rich, or delicate whiskeys, there's something for everyone - even beginners!

There's also a tapas menu, including cheese platters, dips, and pizza.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/barlees-wine-and-whisky-bar-mamaroneck

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

July 9th you are in for a treat!

We’ll be discussing Kabbalah and the Secret to Happiness, and in all actuality, who doesn’t want to be happy?

If there was ever a Kabbalah Night you wouldn’t want to miss, this is it. So, clear your calendars, save the date, and even bring a friend, because there is nothing better than being happy with friends.

You will have the opportunity to experience a truly (free) interactive and fascinating evening delving into happiness through a Kabbalistic lens, with questions and answers, roundtable workshops, and of course, delicious refreshments.

What is more, there is a huge event coming up in a few weeks: An annual Kabbalah Convention in July 24-26. Kabbalah students from all over the world will come together for a weekend, where we get an opportunity to connect with each other and participate in lessons and events with a Kabbalist of our time, our teacher Dr. Laitman.

results.name: Write!

results.description:
The book for July is I SHALL BE NEAR TO YOU by Erin Lindsay McCabe.

An extraordinary novel about a strong-willed woman who disguises herself as a man in order to fight beside her husband, inspired by the letters of a remarkable female soldier who fought in the Civil War. Rosetta doesn't want her new husband Jeremiah to enlist, but he joins up, hoping to make enough money that they'll be able to afford their own farm someday. Though she's always worked by her father’s side as the son he never had, now that Rosetta is a wife she's told her place is inside with the other women. But Rosetta decides her true place is with Jeremiah, no matter what that means, and to be with him she cuts off her hair, hems an old pair of his pants, and signs up as a Union soldier.


 With the army desperate for recruits, Rosetta has no trouble volunteering, although she faces an incredulous husband. She drills with the men, proves she can be as good a soldier as anyone, and deals with the tension as her husband comes to grips with having a fighting wife. Rosetta's strong will clashes with Jeremiah's while their marriage is tested by broken conventions, constant danger, and war, and she fears discovery of her secret even as they fight for their future, and for their lives. Inspired by more than 250 documented accounts of the women who fought in the Civil War while disguised as men, I Shall Be Near To You is the intimate story, in Rosetta’s powerful and gorgeous voice, of the drama of marriage, one woman’s amazing exploits, and the tender love story that can unfold when two partners face life’s challenges side by side.
results.name: July 2015 - I SHALL BE NEAR TO YOU

results.description:
If you're Canadian, you may already know that Crokinole is one of our nation's oldest (but also least known) games.

If you don't know the game, then you've been missing out! And it's not too late for you. Crokinole is one of the easiest dexterity games to learn.

It's like a combination of shuffleboard, curling, and billiards - played on a small table-top board. You flick small discs with the aim of knocking off your opponent's pieces and placing yours in good scoring (or snookering) positions.

It's jolly fun and social. We play every week in a great Greenpoint bistro (Milk and Roses). We have the back of the place reserved specifically for us, every Thursday night from 7pm-11:30pm.


Feel free to come anytime. Jump in a game. Watch if you prefer. Drink and food specials for all players ($8 burgers and pasta; $3 beers).

We'll have several boards out (depending on the number of RSVPs).

Good music too, including live piano for a couple of hours (9-11pm).

If you RSVP 'yes,' please make sure you come or change your RSVP to 'no' if your plans change. I bring boards from home, based on the number of people down to play. And as you may know, they're not light. Hence, the importance to me of following through with your RSVP...


Thanks and hope to see you there!
results.name: Crokinole Nights

WE DID IT!!! PRESIDENT'S DISTINGUISHED!!!

HAPPY NEW YEAR TOASTMASTERS!!

Regular club meeting dates and times are the 1st and 3rd Thursday of every month @ 7:30 p.m. Rm 28 unless otherwise noted. We meet in Co-op City, 2049 Bartow Ave. Bartow Mall (lower level) Bronx, NY10475. Parking is free in Garage 5 on Asch Loop. Our meetings start on time and are planned with you in mind. We have manual speeches given by members as well as invited speakers who are more proficient standing at the podium. We always try for the highest level of meetings with learning and fun in mind. The Only thing missing is you!

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.
results.name: North Jersey Web Development Group Meeting

group.name: North Jersey Web Design & Adobe Tools Group

results.description:
Directions: Subway: Take the D or A (Express train) C or B (local) trains to West 59th Columbus Ave. Walk to 63rd street (you should see Citi Bank on the corner), then make a right. Walk down the block (you should pass a parking lot entrance) and then you will come upon YMCA entrances. There are two entrances, if one is not open, please walk to the next one.

At the security desk, tell the guard you are here to attend the Poetry on Demand Meet up group. They will tell you which room to go to. Please message me with questions!

Event Details: We will meet at the West Side YMCA, seating 15 people!! Will serve pizza & sodas/water. We will be in a big bright spacious community room, white board/markers, tables, chairs. 

We will be creating & sharing new poems on demand and playing poem mini games! Please bring:

• Your own supplies (pen, paper, tablets, laptops..etc)

• Original poems to share; bring ideas to write about.

• An open mind, positive attitude & a smile!! :-)
results.name: Poetry on Demand Session - West Side YMCA

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Thursday- 7:45pm@W102nd Street Field

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in New York City?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early. Near the Lincoln Center.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact Michal at [masked] or call[masked]-2255. Can’t make this event? see www.turnonny.us for more. Directions to venue:

Our address is the Metropolitan Opera Guild, 70 Lincoln Center Plaza, 6th Floor. We are located in the Samuel B. and David Rose Building at Lincoln Center, equivalent to 165 West 65th Street, between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue. The Rose Building is adjacent to the Walter Reade Movie Theater and both are next door to the Juilliard School. From the street, take the elevator, escalator, or stairs up one level and proceed through the revolving door of the lobby of the Rose Building. You will need to check in with Security in the lobby and they will have your name on a list. Proceed to the 6th Floor.
results.name: TurnON Upper West Side

results.description:
Learn to square dance with Times Squares! Our new “Mainstream Essentials” class will have you dancing in no time. Howard Richman, caller extraordinaire, will be teaching this new curriculum to introduce you to the exciting world of Modern Western Square Dance. If you’ve wanted to learn to dance but can’t commit to a longer class, this is the perfect opportunity for you. By the end of the summer you’ll be amazed at how much you’ve learned and how much fun you’re having. Sign up today. Class size is limited.

Classes will be held weekly from 8 – 9:30 PM at CAP21 Studios on the following dates: July 9, 16, 23, 30, August 6, 13, 20, 27, September 3, 10, 17, 24. Tuition $120 for all sessions payable in advance or on the first day of class.

results.description:
Following the success of RiffTrax Live: Sharknado in 2014, the internal shark chainsawer Ian Ziering is back! This time the titular weather event hits the city of New York, right as all the gruff and busy inhabitants are trying to walk, over here! And no famous landmark is safe from their wrath, including perennially grumpy New Yorker Judd Hirsch. 

Hold on... didn't Judd Hirsch die in the first one? 

You guys, this movie is going to be terrible.

Buy your tickets now, before they sell out!

results.description:
This Thursday Only is TurnedOn Women's Panel!

Dear Woman,

My name is Eugenia and I’m writing to invite you to our TurnedOn Women’s Panel. 

We don’t have secrets from you.  We would like to share with you what it means, looks and feels like to be a TurnedOn woman. 

Our topic is simple!

Orgasm! 

Have you ever caught yourself or your female friends chanting some version of, “I work too hard! I eat too much!  I diet too much! I drink too much! I shop too much! I give too much! I’m too emotional! I’m too much!” 


All this chanting can be boiled down to two words: “I’m Hungry.” 


Many of us simply have a fundamental hunger to connect with another human being. Instead, all we do is reach out for substitutes in our life to fill the void without realizing that we abandoned our desires in order to fit in, look good, and have the approval of our community, family, and friends.


In our discussion about orgasm and what it means to be a TurnedOn woman, we will share with you a different way and definition of orgasm.  It’s not going to be a conversation about that fleeting moment of climax. It’s going to be a conversation about orgasm that actually works with the woman’s body.  When you have this, this whole notion of frigidity, shame, shyness or lack of sex drive flies out the window.  What it’s replaced with is an entire life time of a journey of discovering of who you are and how your particular orgasm works.

This is an intimate conversation among women about our desires. We open up to talk about how to connect your hunger with your desires, say what you want in real time and have your way with the world in achieving and receiving everything you want in life.

Doors for this event close at 8:10

COST TO ATTEND IS $10

For questions feel free to contact Marissa at [masked] or[masked]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s9QVq0EM6g4

UPDATE: Tickets are now available for purchase online:

http://www.slipperroom.com/event/891763-guest-event-harry-potter-new-york/

Hotsy Totsy Burlesque is one of NYC's premiere Burlesque shows. Each show is a fully scripted homage to a particular element of pop culture.

The Harry Potter show has become a tradition and each year there is a new script and new performers paying homage to the no longer a boy wizard.

The shows cast includes:

Cherry Pitz, Liberty Rose, Tiger Bay, Carriage Return, Teddy Turnaround, Mary Cyn, Erika Rodgers, and Petite Renard.

Mary Cyn in particular is bringing back a HP routine she is famous for and you don't want to miss.

Tickets are $10 but are not online yet, but they will be available on www.slipperroom.com

We recommend pre-purchasing tickets and arriving early to get good seats. Doors usually open around 7/7:30pm and the show starts at 8pm.

This venue is 21+ only.

Start the weekend with some FREE LAUGHS!!

This Thursday at 8pm I'm hosting a FREE LIVE COMEDY SHOW at the Village Lantern, right in the heart of historic Greenwich Village!!

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!! Being just around the corner from the Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St. Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:
$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine

Food:
$5 Mozzarella Sticks,
$5 Fresh Cut Fries
$5 Nachos

$5 Chicken Wings

** 1 item minimum for the show **

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)
results.name: Thursday 8:15pm Tron Ball - Night Soccer @ LIC (7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
“3 And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 4 And I prayed unto the LORD my God, and made my confession , and said , O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandment; “ (Daniel 9:3-4; KJV)

Please join us for “Prayer for our Nation,” hosted monthly by The Daniel Team, the Prayer Ministry of the Christian Party of America. The “Prayer for our Nation” conference call is the second Thursday of every month at 8:30 PM eastern (7:30 central).  The Daniel Team is led by Luis Chiang.   You do not need to be a member of the Christian Party to participate in the prayer conference calls or the other monthly conference calls for the Christian Party.   If you would like to become a member of the Daniel Team, please send an email to [masked] requesting to join the prayer ministry.  Thank you.

For more information about the Christian Party of America, go to www.ChristianPartyonline.com.  And Please like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Christian-Party-of-America/198905400159491

Prayer Objectives:

1.  True repentance, in the hearts of our citizens, which manifests itself in our daily lives.

2.  The healing and restoration of families in America.

3.  The restoration of Biblical principles employed in the ruling of our nation from the local to the national level.

4.  To teach the Church to maintain this righteous life so that once America is restored we will continue to teach the Body (including our children) to maintain godliness in our personal and public lives.

Prayer Strategies:

1.  We need to search our hearts and ask the Lord to reveal to us any sins that may be preventing Him from fully answering our prayers. (Joshua 7:10)  Once revealed, we need to confess our sins to Him (and repent of them) and, if appropriate, to those whom we offended.

2.  We need to assume the sins of the nation on ourselves; just as Daniel did for the sins of the nation of Israel (Daniel 9).

3.  It is absolutely crucial that in all these endeavors that prayer be our primary focus.  We need to rely on prayer (Jesus) as the foundation for everything that we do.  In addition, prayer teams need to be set up that will pray before, during, and after all events, etc. in order to bath in prayer everything that we do.  These prayer teams will be the “heavy lifters” who will be moving heaven and earth for us as we fight to regain our nation.

4.  We should follow (among other prayers in the Word), the prayers of repentance and requests for restoration that we find in the Bible, as we pray for our nation.

Prayer Focus:

1.  Jesus is the only way and the only power that will enable our nation to turn around (2 Cor 7:14). We need to focus on Him and to trust in Him alone, as we confess and turn from our sins; that He will tear down the strongholds of the enemy in our nation and in our individual lives. “When the enemy comes in; like a flood the Spirit of the Lord will lift up a standard against him.” (Isa 59:19). We must not trust in any tactic, procedure, or whatever in order to overcome the devil (who is behind all of the evil that we see around us). “For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.” Ephesians 6:11-13

2.  We need to ensure that we stay focused.  The enemy (Satan) will try different tactics against us, e.g., to get our focus off of that which is most important and to either divert our attention on that which is least important and/or try to get us to do too much.  He will probably try to bring division amongst us.  My guess is that it would be through misunderstandings, hurt feelings, etc.  We must be aware of this up-front, expecting the attacks and to realize that the attacks are coming from the enemy and not from what we can, e.g., see with our natural eyes.

Prayer Tactics:

1.  We need to find appropriate Scriptures to stand upon to bring before the Lord as we pray individually and corporately.  It is crucial that we not follow a hard fast cook book approach; even one that is based on the Bible.  We need to know what the Scriptures say and then to allow the Holy Spirit to use what He’s taught us to do or to pray those things that He brings to mind or puts into our hearts to do.  For example, don’t have the “Hail Mary” prayer approach, e.g., I always have to pray this way or to pray these prayers in this exact order.

2.  The Church needs to be actively involved in politics and other social endeavors such as education, health care, the legal system, etc. (if even just knowing what is going on). In politics, the Body should then intelligently and with Christ-like love contact their representatives making their viewpoints known.  These godly leaders need to then rally the Body perhaps at local auditoriums, stadiums, etc. in order show the Church the truth about how our nation began and how the Church was actively involved in all facets of social life for the first few hundred years of our pre- and post-national existence.  The Body needs to learn that we must stand on what God’s Word says and to fight for what’s ours (just as the Israelites entered the Promised Land, fought huge giants, and won). 

Finally, remember:

2 Chron 16:9 “For the eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to him…”

PREPARATION FOR PRAYER-STUDY MATERIALS

Repentance from Idolatry

All the sins described below are the symptoms of a bigger sickness, which is denying God as our creator and not glorifying him and acknowledging him as the supreme ruler of the universe. Rom 1:29 states “All Unrighteousness” stems out from the root of idolatry (Rom1:23). So, fornication is not a sickness, it is one of the symptoms of idolatry, covetousness is not a sickness, it is another symptom of idolatry, etc.

It is very important to focus our prayer efforts on this first cause of sin, which is ignoring God, suppressing the truth, and replacing the Creator by the created. God and truth are self-evident, but we choose to rebel against it. What we need is to repent from that.

Studying the nature of repentance would help tremendously in our efforts to pray and intercede for people because repentance is the key to come back to God and be healed.

Rom 1:18  For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Rom 1:19  Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

Rom 1:20  For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

Rom 1:21  Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Rom 1:22  Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Rom 1:23  And changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.

Rom 1:24  Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Rom 1:25  Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

Rom 1:26  For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Rom 1:27  And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Rom 1:28  And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Rom 1:29  Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Rom 1:30  Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Rom 1:31  Without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Rom 1:32  Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Here’s an example of what causes repentance:

Let’s pray that America focus on the much that we have, so our hearts is filled with thanksgiving for his goodness towards us, and our hearts lead us to repentance.

Rom_2:4  Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

Let’s pray that the end result of America’s tribulations, the recession, the aging and health deterioration of Americans, the financial distress, etc. work for our good, changing our hearts and drawing closer to God.

2Co_7:10  For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Let’s pray that America realize that God wants every American to be saved and not face judgment. Let’s pray that our pastors emphasize the human responsibility in determining our final destiny

2Pe_3:9  The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Other observations on the word Repentance

The word repentance is used in connection with God, as well as with man. When it is used in connection with God, it is usually positive. God never repents to do good for his people. God repents himself from exercising judgment and punishment on his people.

Let’s pray that God will change his mind executing the punishment that we deserve.

Num_23:19  God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

1Sa_15:29  And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.

Psa_110:4  The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Psa_135:14  For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

Jer_18:8  If that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

Satan is the God of this world. He endows his faithful servants with power to promote sin from the top down. In that sense, it is very important to know that sin is not based on grass root strategies; it is a highly organized well-funded push strategy.

Blindness comes from Satan.

Let’s pray in the Name of Jesus and bind Satan’s power, rebuke his authority, and order him to take away his hands off America. Let’s pray that the spiritual veil be torn and people be able to see what’s evident.

2Co_4:4  In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Joh 12:40  He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Excerpts from the Book of Daniel (Chapter 9):

 “…3 So I turned to the Lord God and pleaded with him in prayer and petition, in fasting, and in sackcloth and ashes.

4 I prayed to the LORD my God and confessed:

“Lord, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with those who love him and keep his commandments, 5 we have sinned and done wrong. We have been wicked and have rebelled; we have turned away from your commands and laws. 6 We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our ancestors, and to all the people of the land.

7 “Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame—the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far, in all the countries where you have scattered us because of our unfaithfulness to you. 8 We and our kings, our princes and our ancestors are covered with shame, LORD, because we have sinned against you. 9 The Lord our God is merciful and forgiving, even though we have rebelled against him; 10 we have not obeyed the LORD our God or kept the laws he gave us through his servants the prophets. 11 All Israel has transgressed your law and turned away, refusing to obey you.

“Therefore the curses and sworn judgments written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against you. 12 You have fulfilled the words spoken against us and against our rulers by bringing on us great disaster. Under the whole heaven nothing has ever been done like what has been done to Jerusalem. 13 Just as it is written in the Law of Moses, all this disaster has come on us, yet we have not sought the favor of the LORD our God by turning from our sins and giving attention to your truth. 14 The LORD did not hesitate to bring the disaster on us, for the LORD our God is righteous in everything he does; yet we have not obeyed him.

15 “Now, Lord our God, who brought your people out of Egypt with a mighty hand and who made for yourself a name that endures to this day, we have sinned, we have done wrong. 16 Lord, in keeping with all your righteous acts, turn away your anger and your wrath from Jerusalem, your city, your holy hill. Our sins and the iniquities of our ancestors have made Jerusalem (America) and your people an object of scorn to all those around us.

17 “Now, our God, hear the prayers and petitions of your servant. For your sake, Lord, look with favor on your desolate sanctuary. 18 Give ear, our God, and hear; open your eyes and see the desolation of the city that bears your Name. We do not make requests of you because we are righteous, but because of your great mercy. 19 Lord, listen! Lord, forgive! Lord, hear and act! For your sake, my God, do not delay, because your city and your people bear your Name. ”

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 9):

After these things had been done, the leaders came to me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the neighboring peoples with their detestable practices, like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites. 2 They have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, and have mingled the holy race with the peoples around them. And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.”

3 When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled. 4 Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice.

5 Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the LORD my God 6 and prayed:

“I am too ashamed and disgraced, my God, to lift up my face to you, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens. 7 From the days of our ancestors until now, our guilt has been great. Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today…

10 “But now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commands 11 you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: ‘The land you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the corruption of its peoples. By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other. 12 Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.’

13 “What has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins deserved and have given us a remnant like this. 14 Shall we then break your commands again and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices? Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor? 15 LORD, the God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.”

5.  Pray that the Lord will rise up godly pastors (or Church leaders) who will agree to work together to preach and teach on preparing the Church, e.g., to first of all pray and fast for our nation in small and large gatherings (at work during lunch hour, at home, in parks, at church, at social gatherings, etc.) around our nation; asking the Lord to have mercy on America (as we, as Christians confess our sins of idolatry, ambivalence, etc. to Him.  Also, these leaders should teach of the need for the Church to be actively involved in the world (to be the salt and the light of the world).  But, everything - absolutely everything should be focused on love; the Father’s agape love being shown to the world.  “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.  By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.” (John 13:[masked])

As an example of a godly leader raising the awareness of God’s people to gather together in repentance, is Ezra:

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 10):

“While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites—men, women and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly. 2 Then Shekaniah son of Jehiel, one of the descendants of Elam, said to Ezra, “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel. 3 Now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all these women and their children, in accordance with the counsel of my lord and of those who fear the commands of our God. Let it be done according to the Law. 4 Rise up; this matter is in your hands. We will support you, so take courage and do it.”

5 So Ezra rose up and put the leading priests and Levites and all Israel under oath to do what had been suggested. And they took the oath. 6 Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and went to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. While he was there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he continued to mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.

7 A proclamation was then issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem. 8 Anyone who failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, in accordance with the decision of the officials and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.

9 Within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin had gathered in Jerusalem. And on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people were sitting in the square before the house of God, greatly distressed by the occasion and because of the rain. 10 Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful; you have married foreign women, adding to Israel’s guilt. 11 Now honor[a] the LORD, the God of your ancestors, and do his will. Separate yourselves from the peoples around you and from your foreign wives.”

12 The whole assembly responded with a loud voice: “You are right! We must do as you say. 13 But there are many people here and it is the rainy season; so we cannot stand outside. Besides, this matter cannot be taken care of in a day or two, because we have sinned greatly in this thing. 14 Let our officials act for the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at a set time, along with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.” 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this.

16 So the exiles did as was proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, one from each family division, and all of them designated by name. On the first day of the tenth month they sat down to investigate the cases, 17 and by the first day of the first month they finished dealing with all the men who had married foreign women.”

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

NOTE: THIS EVENT IS NOW SOLD OUT! THERE WILL NOT BE ANY ABILITY TO REGISTER ON-SITE FOR THIS EVENT. SIGN UP FOR THE WAIT LIST AT https://askavc-nyc-0715.eventbrite.com  -- don't sign up here!


We're doing it again! This time it's bigger and better - with even more investors, FOUR panels on VC and investing,  FOUR Lightning Rounds, and a Venture Fair where you get a chance for some 1:1 with the investors there. This time EVERYONE is able to meet the investors as part of the Venture Fair.

We'll have over THIRTY FIVE (35) awesome Venture Capital (VC) and Angel Investors there answering your questions on what is VC, the process for getting VC, what investors look for, and more. Plus a chance to tell your story and meet with some of the investors 1:1.

Participating investors:

• Basset Investment Group - Ryan Darnell

• BBG Ventures - Samantha Lynch

• Bowery Capital - Eric Vreeland

• Brand Foundry Ventures - Sumeet Shah

• Comcast Ventures - Tyler Flint

• Corigin Ventures - David Goldberg

• ffVC - Steven Greenberg

• Fintech Collective - Travis Skelly


• Gotham Ventures - Alex Malorodov


• Greycroft - Weston Reynolds

• Hearst Ventures - Travis Ing 

• Indicator Ventures - Jonathan Struhl


• Interplay Ventures - Jeremy Banon

• Kbs+ Ventures - Jessica Peltz-Zatulove

• KEC Ventures - Chris Fortunato

• Lightbank - Rick Zullo


• MESA+ - Adam Carver


• Metamorphic VC - Joshua Nussbaum

• Osage Ventures - Sean Dowling

• Paladin Capital Group - Gibb Witham

• Pearson Venture Group - Katelyn Donnelly


• Primary Venture Partners - Jeff Prober

• Reveal Partners - Charlie Kemper


• Rubicon - Joshua Siegel

• Safeguard Scientifics - David Luk


• Samsung Strategic - Joseph Coyne, Timothy Casio, Christiana Ting

• SeedInvest - Jay Tharkar


• Simon Venture Group - Skyler Fernandes 

• SoGal Ventures - Elizabeth Galbut


• Spark Capital - Katie Bolin

• TechStars NYC - Jenny Fielding

• Vayner/RSA - Shawn Cheng


• Verizon Ventures - Christian Guirnalda


• White Star Capital - Lylan Masterman


Venue & Date

Friday July 10, 2015
8AM to 11:30AM

Microsoft Times Square
11 Times Square
New York, NY

PRESENTED BY Orrick TOTAL ACCESS

https://www.filepicker.io/api/file/ReocbDn3QC66XCm8y39U

Orrick is a global law firm with a particular focus on serving companies in the technology, energy and financial sectors. Presented by experienced industry CEOs, venture capitalists and Orrick lawyers, TOTAL ACCESS offers insights on cutting-edge issues and an opportunity to network with leading professionals in Los Angeles, New York and Silicon Valley. Hosted by Orrick in Silicon Valley, San Francisco, New York and Los Angeles, TOTAL ACCESS events are available exclusively to entrepreneurs, start-up company executives and the investment community. Learn more at http://blogs.orrick.com/totalaccess/


FOUR VC Panels

We've had such significant demand for this event, that we'll be running FOUR Venture Capital panels, with two going on at the same time. Can't figure out which one to attend? Feel free to attend either or both. We'll be having two panels with different topics and different investors at each one. The panels will run in "Ask Me Anything" style, which means that we'll have a few canned questions to start, but it's all about you.

If you've signed up for a Lightning Round, just make sure to be in the right room at the right time!

Agenda & Schedule

08:00 - 08:30  ::  Registration and Networking08:30 - 08:40  ::  Welcomes


08:40 - 09:15  ::  VC Panel #1 - "Seed and Series A Financing I" + Ask Me Anything - Moderated by Ronald Schmelzer


08:40 - 09:15  ::  VC Panel #2 - "Emerging Trends in VC I" + Ask Me Anything - Moderated by Sumeet Shah


09:15 - 09:40  ::  Lightning Round #1


09:40 - 10:15  ::  VC Panel #3 - "Emerging Trends in VC II" + Ask Me Anything09:40 - 10:15  ::  VC Panel #4 - "Seed and Series A II" + Ask Me Anything10:15 - 10:40  ::  Lightning Round #2


10:40 - 11:45  ::  Venture Fair 11:45 :: Event Wraps up



VC Panel #1 - "Seed and Series A Financing" + Ask Me Anything
The first panel will be a VC 101 panel focused on Early State Financing, moderated by Ronald Schmelzer, focusing on the following topics:

•  What does your firm invest in and focus on?

• How do you even begin talking to a VC?

• What's the process like for soliciting, interacting with, and getting investment from VCs

• PLUS YOUR questions in "Ask Me Anything" style

VC Panel #2 - "Emerging Trends in VC" + Ask Me Anything
The second panel will be with additional investors focused on later rounds identifying emerging trends in Venture Capital and investing, moderated by Ronald Schmelzer, focusing on the following topics:

•  What are the latest hot areas for investors?

• What's big in the NY region?

• What's changing in the way companies are getting funded?

• PLUS YOUR questions in "Ask Me Anything" style


TWO 20 minute Lightning Rounds:
Your Chance to Have Everyone Hear Your Story!
 Each Lightning Round will consist of five randomly selected participants who have elected to participate in a public embarrassment, er, I mean public feedback. They will get 1 minute (timed) to do an Elevator Pitch with no slides and no supporting material, plus 4 minutes of questions and feedback from the the full panel. For this event, we'll be running two of these Lightning Rounds in front of different panels so we'll maximize the fun and randomness.

The Venture Fair

Want an opportunity to chat 1:1 with investors in your area of interest? We'll be running a venture fair with our attending investors, who will have dedicated areas, where they will meet as many of you as they can in "Job Fair" style. This means you'll queue up in front of the investors of your choice and you'll get as much time as they can afford before the event concludes. It will be a mosh-pit of investor fun.

Breakfast Sponsored by Ciklum

https://www.filepicker.io/api/file/5yEFwb4eQHyest7Z8WMl

Over The Last 12 Years Ciklum Has Helped 200+ Companies EstablishOffshore and Nearshore Software Development Centres, To Optimize Their Software Development Needs. Learn more at http://www.ciklum.com.



Networking Sponsored by OfficeLeaseCenter.com

https://www.filepicker.io/api/file/CrpAqYhQrGSaIvcyQfzQ

OfficeLeaseCenter.com helps startup founders and entrepreneurs find flexible and affordable office locations.

*** TO RSVP FOR THIS EVENT, PLEASE GO TO OUR LINK AT https://askavc-nyc-0715.eventbrite.com****

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured!

Featuring:

Geoff Guerdat is the Director of Data Engineering at Gilt, an e-commerce shopping website offering members a luxury lifestyle through clothing, home decor, and local activities. 

Gilt's Data Engineering team is a technical team responsible for information architecture, data warehousing, reporting, data science, a/b testing and web analytics. 

Every day Geoff enjoys destroying and rebuilding architectures, motorcycles, snowboards and old cars. His technical background ranges from large scale HPC architecture to data science with a handful of pit stops in between.

Village Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

For more dining options with designers, developers and entrepreneurs, check out:

http://www.meetup.com/Downtown-Tech-Breakfast/

http://www.meetup.com/UWS-Startup-Meetup/

http://www.meetup.com/Midtown-Tech-Breakfast/

http://www.meetup.com/Startup-Dim-Sum/

results.description:
Hi All,

This will be a 20-25 mile loop in the West Canada Lake Wilderness Area.  We plan on beginning at 9:00 AM Friday morning and hopefully wrapping up the trip between noon and 2:00 PM on Sunday.    


This trip would be suitable for adventurous beginners and definitely for  anyone with some backpacking experience.  Elevation gain/loss is minimal as it's only about 1600+ and 1600- feet over the course of the entire trip.     According to the guides for the area, the terrain is not too hilly although at times it can be very wet and or muddy.

This will be updated as the date draws closer.

Checkout the following links for more information on the area.

Overview from Trimble Outdoors


Alltrails.com


Argis.com


Backpackinglight.com
results.how_to_find_us: 43.583793, -74.481930  Look for the black jeep liberty in the trailhead parking lot.
results.name: Backpacking in the ADKs: 23 miles West Canada Lakes Wildnerness Loop

results.description:
Hello Friends

Join us this coming Friday as we have Andra Tomsa coming by to share her journey. Andra is an entrepreneur, young mom, and hardcore philanthropist. Andra founded SPARE (http://sparenyc.org) when her son turned two months old and built a large part of the business with a baby on her hip.


When she's not prowling the city on a mission to fight hunger, she can be found reading in fuzzy toe socks, ripping down the mountain in her skis, cuddling babies, and dancing around aimlessly. Andra lives in the South Bronx with her dog, cat, baby boy, and fiancee.

There will be a time for Q&A/networking afterwards so please email us any questions you may want her to address.

Feel free to forward this to your friends that you think may be interested! Until then, stay cool and classy..

See you this Friday!

In Good Company

results.description:
New members are always welcomed - After you join, please make sure you RSVP early so we can reserve a seat for you.

We discuss current business methods at the meetings . If you want to share an method with the group, so they have "time to think about it." Please email me and I'll include your issue/concern with my weekly email address to the entire meetup group, not just this weeks attendees.

The basic agenda is...

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

09:50 to 10:10 Introductions

10:10 to 11:00 Current Business Methods

11:00 and on.... Open and Individual Networking

Be ready to discuss your business and be open to hear some new ideas/criticism that will require you to look at yourself/your business differently.

Most people take a few notes, so some paper would be good.

Best Regards,
Steve Navazio

results.description:
This is a ride with loads of hills and fun we will start off from the visitor center out of Harriman into sterling forest via Long Meadow Road then turning right onto 17 at the Renaissance Festival then heading up 106 straight through Kiawah key circle sweet fast 3 mile 40mph downhill down through Tomkins Cove turning left on 9D riding up via Seven Lakes Drive through bear mountain up to Perkins Memorial Drive then a straight shot down Seven Lakes Drive back to the car. We may possibly take a dip in the water at teoroti circle.

Surprise swim: so bring a lock although we will be able to see our bikes from where we are we don't want them to roll off by themselves having fun without us!

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Greetings Spirit Workers, 

ANU Nation is currently putting together a small spiritual action retreat to perform the needed spiritual work and readings for many of you who've inquired over the past year about consecrations, in-person readings, offerings, rituals, and other prescribed or desired rites.


Right now we are looking at July 10th through July 12th as the dates for the retreat.

ADDITIONAL SERVICES INCLUDE: 


• Spiritual Offerings to spiritual guides/guardians/ancestors/etc...

• Head Cleansing

• Ebo's

• and more...

DATE: 
July 10th-July 12th (Fri-Sun)

LOCATION:  
Catawbwa Falls Camp, North Carolina. 

ACCOMMODATION DETAILS:

This retreat is not only for spiritual work, but also a time for communing with nature (cultivating iwa pele,) and for fellowship. 

There will be Men's, Wombyn's and Family cabins. Everyone will be assigned to a cabin that will be shared with your fellow spirit workers. If you are coming as a family and would like a cabin to yourselves please include that in your email as listed in step 1. below, along with how many people are in your family. 

Cabins house up to 4 people

Cabins have electric inside, with lights, heater, refrigerator and a fan. Outside there is a BBQ grill and fire pit.

This is a step up from tent camping but still bring everything you normally camp with, except the tent. 


DOWN PAYMENT/RSVP:
$100.00 

NEXT STEPS:

1. Contact us at <a>[masked]</a>to let us know EXACTLY what spiritual work you would like. Once this is done, we can give you an exact quote. The quote will include the costs for your spiritual work and accommodations. 

2.Once you receive your quote, RSVP with your down payment to secure your spot. You will be invoiced for the remainder of your balance. 

This is a spiritual action gathering for those interested in doing spiritual work. 

Please send in your inquiries and RSVP no later than 6/18/15 so that we can properly prepare for the work . 

We look forward to seeing you there. 

ANU Nation

results.description:
Hi NYC Yogis,

We will have our next NYC Yoga meetup event this coming Friday July 10 at Noon at Washington Square Park! We will meet at the Arch of Washington Square Park 11:45AM and We'll walk to one of the lawn to have our yoga practice. It's open-level, so whether you're beginner, intermediate or more advanced, you can always modify your poses accordingly. 

What To Bring:

Yoga mats, yoga props if needed, bottle of water, and your friends. I have a few yoga mats I can bring just in case someone needs it. Personally, I prefer the grass. 

What NOT To Bring:

A full stomach. It's advised that we should practice yoga Asanas on an empty stomach. But if you feel you need to have something, let it be light, like a juice or smoothie.

Any questions, or if you can't find us, contact me at[masked]-8318.

Look forward to meeting and sharing the yoga practice with all of you.

Your NYC Yoga Meetup Organizer,

Wai Mark (known as Mark to friends)

How to find us:
We will meet at the Arch at 11:45AM

results.description:
IV Rapid Whitewater Rafting @ Hudson River Gorge

Whitewater Rafting on the Hudson River Gorge Adirondack Mountains, New York The right rafting trips ... at the right prices ...in the right locations! "White Water Rafting Dam Releases ...the most fun you'll have all year!"
In June, we had Rapid III Whitewater Rafting @ Lehigh River. Many of you mentined the water was too calm and were interested in Rapid IV Whitewater Rafting. So here you are, and we are going to Hudson River for Rapid IV WR.

A whitewater rafting trip through the Hudson River Gorge means western-style whitewater adventure right here in the central Adirondacks of New York!  The Hudson River Gorge is rated one of the Top 10 whitewater rafting runs in America.  And no wonder!  This is the Hudson River as she was meant to be ... crystal clear, clean, alive and powerful, as her unbridled whitewater thunders alongside 500-foot granite cliffs, and through awesome rapids like Givneys' Rift, the Narrows, Little Nasty and Greyhound Bus Stopper. The Hudson River's whitewater is most powerful in the spring and fall; rafting is somewhat more moderate in mid-summer. Scheduled whitewater dam releases assure terrific rafting fun all season long.

For More Info on Whitewater Challengers: http://www.whitewaterchallengers.com/hudson/hudson-whitewater.asp

Adirondack extreme Adventure Course

Other parks have tried to imitate but can’t duplicate the HEART PUMPING,ADRENALINE RUSH of Adirondack Extreme Adventure Course, the United States’ largest AERIAL tree top adventure park.

Open April through November and located in beautiful Bolton Landing, NY just north of Lake George and Diamond Point, Adirondack Extreme boasts over 1.5 miles of thrilling aerial adventures including wobbly bridges, climbing walls, zip lines and swinging surprises at varying levels of height and difficulty. Not your average ropes course, we are the countries #1 rated Aerial adventure park!! Starting Saturday April 5, 2014, the park will be open every Saturday and Sunday to ALL group sizes and operates RAIN or SHINE. Reservations strongly advised (park does sell out).

For More Info on Adirondack extreme Adventure Course:

http://www.adirondackextreme.com/

The House
Accommodates: 13
Bedrooms: 4
Bathrooms: 2.5
Beds: 8


DATE 1 (Friday)

~~Depart Date: July 10th Friday; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

~~Depart 4:00 PM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

~~Depart 5:00 PM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

DATE 2 (Saturday): July 11th departs at 8:30 AM (Whitewater rafting starts 9 AM)

DATE 3 (Sunday): July 12th departs 8:30 AM (arrive at Adirondack extreme Adventure Course at 9:30 AM); afterward, lunch at Lake George and hang out at Lake George for 2 hours; 

RETURN: Departs from Lake George at 4:30 PM & expect to be back at NYC at 9:00 PM & Flushing at 9:30 PM

Overnight Stay (2 nights): We will share a big vacation house that sleeps 13.

Who Should Come: Prior experience on III rapid recommended; not required.

What To Bring: Water bottle, hat, towel, sunblock scream and clothes to change.

What Are Included:

• Saturday Rapid IV Whitewater rafting; All rafting equipments; FREE light lunch snack & BBQ dinner included.

• Two nights stay at a big vacation house; everyone will either share a queen/full bed or take a twin bed.

• Admission ticket to 3 hours Adult Course at Adirondack extreme Adventure Course; Optionally add $5 to upgrade to Adult Extreme Course 

• Round trip transportation & daily transport between Inn & event locations

Cost: Early Birds $269.00 for 1st 7 spots or before 6/22; Afterward Regular $289. 

Maximum: 14

PURCHASE TICKET HERE: http://jul2015raftingweekend.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is not confirmed until the payment is received.

Transportation: Round trip transportation from NYC & daily transport between Inn & event locations are included.

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 20 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.

DIRECTION to Whitewater Challenger Hudson:
From NYC, Philadelphia and South:Follow I-87 Thruway north to Albany (Exit 24); pass through toll booth and follow I-87 Northway north to Warrensburg (Exit 23). Then follow directions From I-87 Northway, Warrensburg Exit (Exit #23) Northbound above.
(IMPORTANT:  DO NOT take Exit #23 from the I-87 NY Thruway, near Albany!)

Pictures from Previous Events:
2011: http://www.nycaaa.com/photos/3109102/
2012: http://www.nycaaa.com/photos/10311642/
2013: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/16815782/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/events/195497002/

Official Whitewater Rafting Video on Hudson River
http://youtu.be/DSeRwNNfW-A

http://youtu.be/DSeRwNNfW-A
