Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
I'm thrilled that you are planning to join us for a taping of Open Mic On Education, the only cable TV/web show for K-12 school and district leadership. The show is our way of 'giving back' to the hard-working administrators that run our nation's schools.  Also, if you offer a product or service to the educational community, it's a great (and FREE) way to be seen by thousands of decision-makers every month.

Here are the details:

Date/Time: Every Friday. Refreshments at 4:30 pm, Show is taped from 5:00 - 6:00 pm

Location:  MNN El Barrio Firehouse Studio  175 E 104th Street, New York, NY

Directions: The studio is located on E. 104th Street between Lexington Ave and 3rd Ave.  Take the 6 Train to 103rd St Station and walk 1 block north.

Stay Informed:  Join our Meetup http://www.meetup.com/Open-Mic-On-Education/

Format: Arrive at least 15 minutes before taping; you will be greeted and seated.  When you are introduced, come up to the mic and deliver a 1-2 minute 'elevator pitch' on your topic.  Then, stay at the mic for a conversational interview with our panel, and field some questions from the audience.  (Note that all questions are friendly and positive; the show is not a "got-you" kind of environment.)

Prep:  Please send via email or bring with you a short bio (one or two highlights is all that's needed) and any media (images, audio or video) that you'd like us to incorporate either into the Live show or for use as B-roll during editing of your segment.  Media may be emailed to [masked].  Alternatively, you may bring the media to the studio on a thumb drive, CD, or DVD, which will be returned to you after we make a copy.

Again, thank you for planning to join us.  We hope you will become a regular presence at our a show and a contributing member of our community.

Alan Rudt
(917)[masked]
[masked]

results.description:
The King Stays King! Yes Sir!

If you've been to any of our Latin Dance Events, you've no doubt heard and danced to the songs of Romeo Santos. A Latin American Mega Star who started off from humble beginnings In the Bronx NY.

If you've never seen this charismatic artist live, now is your opportunity to do it. I have a few tickets available for my self and a small group to go see him together in concert at the Barclay Center In Brooklyn NY On Friday July 10th!

Here Are Some Of His Songs:


Promise: Featuring Usher

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gehm6JFDV-4

Propuesta Indecente (Indecent Proposal)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFs3PIZb3js


Romeo Santos & Aventura: Obsesion (Obsession)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Eul-QAtN6c

Expect to hear a lot of of his new and classic songs, also expect special guest appearances! Don't miss out on one of the hottest latin concerts of the summer! We'll have good seats in the Lower 200's Section.

Price Per Person Is: $149

This Includes Your Ticket And Transportation, So You Save On Tolls, Gas, & Parking. We Leave From Walmart In Garfield NJ.


2 Convenient Payment Options:

Pay In Full For $149... https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=8HW993FB4RAXC

Pay $77 For 2 Months... https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=YZZ6SXWZ8QALC


If You Want To Mail A Check, Send Me A Message On Meetup Or Email Me At: [masked]



About Romeo Santos:

For more than a decade, he's composed, and sang latin style songs that have become very popular at dance clubs, radio stations, and at concerts. Starting off as the lead singer for the group Aventura in the 90's and through the 2000's. He lead the trend of latin & pop style bachata hits that made this particular dance a staple at clubs and dance studios.

Eventually he ventured off into a very successful Solo Career, releasing Romeo Santos: Formula One & Then Romeo Santos: Formula 2. Collaborating with other artists such as Marc Anthony, Carlos Santana, Usher, Drake, Don Omar, & many others! He's won several awards and accolades.

He became The King Of Bachata, and while he was with Aventura, they were known as The Kings of Bachata. As a member of Aventura, Santos has been a key figure in popularizing Bachata, with hits reaching near the top of the Billboard Latin charts and the top of charts in Europe. In 2002, the band's song "Obsesion" was number one in Italy for sixteen consecutive weeks. After releasing several albums with Aventura, the group went its separate ways. Since then, Romeo has embarked on a solo career which in three years has spawned seven number one songs on the Hot Latin Songs chart and eight number ones on the Tropical Songs chart.
results.name: ROMEO SANTOS LIVE CONCERT AT BARCLAY CENTER! TRANSPORTATION PROVIDED! SOLD OUT!

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Another Summer Musical ~  The past 2 years were Fabulous!  Can't beat the Ambiance or the Price!  Admission  $7.00 /  $5.00 for elite 60+  ;) 

This Rodgers & Hammerstein’s first collaboration remains, in many ways, their most innovative, having set the standards and established the rules of musical theatre still being followed today.  Set in a Western Indian Territory just after the turn of the century, the high-spirited rivalry between the local farmers and cowboys provides the colorful background against which Curly, a handsome cowboy, and Laurey, a winsome farm girl, lay out their love story.  Although the road to true loves never runs smooth, with these two headstrong romantics holding the reins, love’s journey is as bumpy as a surrey ride down a country road.  That they will succeed in making a new life together we have no doubt, and that this new life will begin in a brand-new state provides the ultimate climax to the triumphant OKLAHOMA!

Box office opens up at 5:30 

I will be off on Show Day this year and will arrive earlier to get a spot on line. I'll gladly get tickets for anyone.... Just need your chair and your $$ ahead of time. If anyone else plans to arrive early, let me know, we'll wait together! 

Please let if you plan to join us for dinner before the show.              I made a Reservation at Seasons 52 for 6:15pm ~                      There will be seperate checks ~ view menu ...>more >files

if you come later ...there are shuttle buses to assist Parking will harder, later  especially near the boardwalk, so to ensure a pleasurable time for all, the City is encouraging residents to use special “Fireworks Shuttle Buses.” The buses will run from 7pm to 11pm, from the West and East ends, approximately every fifteen minutes. Buses will stop for passengers on corners along the route.

The routes are as follows:

East End: Park Avenue - Buses will leave LIRR Station to pick up passengers on the south side of Park Avenue to Maple Boulevard. The bus will then return on the west side of Broadway, picking up passengers along the way to the event.

West End: Ohio Avenue and Beech Street – Buses will leave Ohio Avenue, picking up passengers along Beech Street to New York Avenue. From there, the bus will turn onto Broadway, picking up passengers to Riverside Boulevard.

Immediately following the fireworks display, shuttle buses will pick up passengers on the Southeast corner of Riverside Boulevard and Broadway for East travelers and the Southwest corner for West travelers through 11PM, returning along the same routes as above.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- OPEN)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Bring out your best jeans for a night of barbeque and brews at Mightly Quinn's. Spareribs, wings, brisket and sides are on the menu. Order and pay at the counter then join us at the Meetup table while they bring over your order.
Meeting: I'll have a Meetup sign at the table.


Located in the Clifton Promenade Shops Mall off Route 3 West.
Menu: http://mightyquinnsbbq.com

Not recommended for vegetarians!

"Mighty Quinnʼs Barbeque borrows from two great barbecue traditions: Texas and the Carolinas. It brings together the best of both and creates something uniquely its own.  The process begins with the best, all-natural meats and poultry, seasoned with perfect spice blends and then smoked with wood for many, many hours until the perfect harmony of smoke, flavor and time emerges. Our food is steeped in tradition but given new life."
results.name: Casual Eats Night- Barbeque @ Mighty Quinns

results.description:
Panna Rittikrai's Vengeance of an Assassin will be getting it's North American festival premiere as part of the NY Asian Film Festival.

Here are the details:

There will never be another Panna Rittikrai. Vengeance of an Assassin is the final, brutal battlesong from the master of mayhem who discovered Tony Jaa and put Thai action cinema on the map. A no-holds-barred all-you-can-eat action fiesta, delivering everything from badass games of soccer to high-impact gun-fu, Vengeance of an Assassin is also the heartwarming story of two buff orphans who believe in filial piety and tearing thugs apart like warm bread. When the older brother (Thai stunt king Dan Chupong) leaves home in search of the truth behind their parents’ deaths, a trail of secrets, carnage, and more carnage follows him wherever he goes. When he’s forced to team up with his little brother (21-year-old Nantawooti Boonrapsup, all grown up since 2010’s Power Kids), it becomes an ass-kicking family affair. The master of single-take destruction, Rittikrai delivers Buster Keaton–style train brawls, flying sledgehammers, copious gun fights, and one glorious Freudian double impalement. In the scorching, sweat-drenched dreamlife of Panna Rittikrai, family and honor are everything, and justice can only be achieved through superior skill and righteous physical destruction.


THAI WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES | FORMAT: DIGITAL PROJECTION | 99 MINUTES


We will be attending the 6pm show. If you need to find us text me @[masked]

For info and tix visit: https://www.universe.com/events/vengeance-of-an-assassin-tickets-new-york-4XTQP

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmle4oRaLlA
results.how_to_find_us: In lobby @ 5:40pm
results.name: Vengeance of an Assassin (6pm show)

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Our City Party Tour is one the most popular of all our events. We turn NYC into one massive party. Everyone gets a pair of special headphones that stream 2 different genres of music to dance to. As we party, our resident tour guide Dave Cervini will be talking into the microphone that streams directly to your headset with interesting facts. In addition to leading the tour, he'll also lead the whole group to flash mob, dance, and shout out to all the unsuspecting onlookers around.

The party starts at The Playwright Irish Pub for drinks before we make our way to Coney Island by subway. Once we reach the beach, the party is on! We’ll be in and out of luna park where we’ll end up at Coney Island’s only OUTDOOR BEACH FRONT Bar to party the night away under the stars and firework show.

Tickets can ONLY BE PURCHASED ONLINE. Follow this link to get yours ASAP as they are almost sold out.

Age Restriction 21+

What you need
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $50. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into the organizer and you’ll receive your registration paper. We end at a bar in which the headphones are returned and you’re more than welcome to party till dawn.
results.name: Coney Island Fireworks Party Tour

49 Grove is a sexy lounge and is a spacious venue, so there is plenty of room to walk around the very attractive space, while mingling with not only other Group members within our VIP section, but with other Latino and Black professionals throughout the rest of the club.

There are two separate rooms with plenty of couches and separate nooks to lounge in!

Start Time: 6pm

Uno

Monopoly

Trouble

Life

Scattegories

and MANY MANY MORE!!!

Please note the details below:

You have to tell the doorman that you are on the Black/Latino Afterwork Drinks Meetup Guestlist.

50% off all Specialty Martinis until 8pm!!!.

Food will be available for order from the kitchen.

We will have music playing as well for those that may want to get some dancing in there in between playing games! :)

We look forward to seeing you there!!!

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
Let's take advantage of free Fridays at MoMA to spend some time in the sculpture garden and look at Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960–1971

Dinner will follow for those who are interested, at the Thai restaurant across the street.  New York Thai Grill & Sushi Bar 37 W 54th St

The Museum of Modern Art presents its first exhibition dedicated exclusively to the work of Yoko Ono, taking as its point of departure the artist’s unofficial MoMA debut in late 1971. At that time, Ono advertised her “one woman show,” titled Museum of Modern [F]art. However, when visitors arrived at the Museum there was little evidence of her work. According to a sign outside the entrance, Ono had released flies on the Museum grounds, and the public was invited to track them as they dispersed across the city. Now, over 40 years later, Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960–1971 surveys the decisive decade that led up to Ono’s unauthorized exhibition at MoMA, bringing together approximately 125 of her early objects, works on paper, installations, performances, audio recordings, and films, alongside rarely seen archival materials. A number of works invite interaction, including Painting to Be Stepped On (1960/1961) and Ono’s groundbreaking performance, Bag Piece (1964). The exhibition draws upon the 2008 acquisition of the Gilbert and Lila Silverman Fluxus Collection Gift, which added approximately 100 of Ono’s artworks and related ephemera to the Museum’s holdings.  keep reading
results.name: FREE Friday at MoMA

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Friday 5:45pm Soccer @ Riverside (7v7) for PS2G

group.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
Our City Party Tour is one the most popular of all our events. We turn NYC into one massive party. Everyone gets a pair of special headphones that stream 2 different genres of music to dance to. As we party, our resident tour guide Dave Cervini will be talking into the microphone that streams directly to your headset with interesting facts. In addition to leading the tour, he'll also lead the whole group to flash mob, dance, and shout out to all the unsuspecting onlookers around.

The party starts at The Playwright Irish Pub for drinks before we make our way to Coney Island by subway. Once we reach the beach, the party is on! We’ll be in and out of luna park where we’ll end up at Coney Island’s only OUTDOOR BEACH FRONT Bar to party the night away under the stars and firework show.

Tickets can ONLY BE PURCHASED ONLINE. Follow this link to get yours ASAP as they are almost sold out.

Age Restriction 21+

What you need 
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works 
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $50. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into the organizer and you’ll receive your registration paper. We end at a bar in which the headphones are returned and you’re more than welcome to party till dawn.
results.name: Coney Island Fireworks Party Tour

Last Co-operative Studios Industry Social was great, this time will be just as exciting at 230 Fifth Lounge in the PENTHOUSE LOUNGE!

Come join us as we network with like-minded professionals - ACTORS, WRITERS, DIRECTORS, PRODUCERS, and FILMMAKERS, to MODELS, AGENTS, PUBLICISTS, COMPOSERS, LAWYERS & STYLISTS.

Co-op Studios Industry Socials NYC is a progressive meeting place for proactive industry professionals to meet, brainstorm and create in a relaxing, fun, and stimulating environment. WE MAKE MOVIES! Not shorts or scenes, but Feature Length Movies for domestic and international distribution. http://www.co-operativestudios.com/

Let’s discuss the endless possibilities! Working producers will be attending looking for New Faces & Talent for upcoming projects. (Please bring business cards/resumes/headshots, dress is casual/smart & Guests are welcomed).

When: Friday, July 10, 2015, 6:00-10PM - FREE

Location: 230 Fifth Lounge, 230 5th Avenue New York, NY 10001

Drink Specials & Great Menu

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

The event begins at 6:30pm but we are gathering at 6:00pm at Wagner Park to meet and get settled.

results.description:
Please join us for our Build Day & Opening Celebration as we kick of six weeks of free art & sustainability-themed public programming for the Bed-Stuy community! 

Free to enter. Drinks will be served. 

Civic Art Lab is a storefront in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn, developed in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s Pop-up Program. This environmental, arts, and educational initiative calls on neighbors to co-produce creative and open ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives happening locally in order to amplify the diverse voices and encourage future community engagement. 

We are constructing our Civic Art Lab throughout the week of July 6th. Neighbors, friends, and anybody interested in sustainability in the arts is invited to join us for conversation, a drink, and an open forum to learn more about the project. 

GREENSPACENYC is a non-profit design collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of a more equitable and sustainable city. 

Questions? Email [masked].
results.how_to_find_us: We are centrally located at Nostrand Avenue & Jefferson Avenue
results.name: Civic Art Lab | Final Build Day| Opening Celebration

results.description:
Want to give a shout out to a pretty cool VR hackaton event. Details below.

Feel free to post or checkout the discussion board if you're looking for a group.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/vr-hackathon-mythos-moxie-tickets-16768828016?aff=es2

In partnership with NYVR, NYC Media Lab and Littlstar, LoNyLa (London-NY-LA)/TimeWave launches the VR Hackathon on July 10-12, 2015. For more info, go to:http://timewavefestival.com/hackathons.html.

Hosted by the Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP) at New York University, the hackathon will take place on Floor 4 of NYU Tisch at 721 Broadway, NYC 10003. Our generous sponsors include Unity 3D, EEVO, Fake Love, Leap Motion,Littlstar, Oculus and VISR.

The VR Hackathon will provide a lab environment for the experimentation and innovation of virtual reality – experiences, storytelling and games. 

The intense two-day format enables people with diverse skillsets to come together, conjure up and prototype concepts for virtual reality and other immersive technologies. Participants can mingle at the mega meet up on friday night before hunkering down for the hackathon. Awards will be given to outstanding projects as judged by a panel of seasoned veterans in the media and entertainment industry.

The theme: Mythos and Moxie. While technology evolves at an accelerated rate, the fundamental tenets of story (Greek: "mythos") remain the same. Story transcends technology and strikes the human heart. It allows us to glimpse universal truths as well as leads us to self discovery. 

In the 2015 VR Hackathon, we encourage participants to probe VR with an eye on storytelling. We also support media creators with moxie - courage. Try things that have yet to be tried. In every project that fails, something is gained or learned.

Awards will be given to outstanding VR as judged by a panel of seasoned professionals in media, entertainment and immersive technology.

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Cristina Rodríguez

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
Only up to 10 participants per group. We'll have two groups running at the same time.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and John Estrada from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over twelve years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. John is a dynamic instructor from Colombia with a good sense of humor and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues in Colombia and the rest of the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/disruption.jpg?itok=Og9FSe6Y Co-sponsored by 350NYC, New York Society for Ethical Culture, and Bronx Climate Justice North, this event will feature “Disruption," a film by Kelly Nyks and Jared P. Scott. The movie explores the organizing work that led up to the People’s Climate March, the power of protest movements, and the issue of climate change through a social justice lens. 

After the movie, we will have presentations by student leaders working on university fossil fuel divestment campaigns as well as community activists working on the New York City pension divestment campaign. We will discuss takeaways from the movie, their implications on fossil fuel divestment campaigns, and next steps for intergenerational, cross-campaign collaboration. 

We hope to create an intimate, all-ages space that can provide networking opportunities for students, alumni, and community members in New York City. As movers, shakers, and doers with a shared vision of a sustainable and just world, we must come together to cultivate critical thought and proactively support each other’s efforts.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
This ride is rescheduled for Friday night....0% precipitation plus fireworks..

We’ll meet up near Columbus Circle for a bit of social time before we pedal our way out to Coney Island. Bring your swimsuit, towel, snacks, and whatever else you need to be ready for an 18 mile ride to the beach! 

Be sure to pack a spare tubes and make sure your bike is in good working order – alternatively be prepared to jump on a train if your bike breaks down.


WHEN: Meet up at 6:30 PM; Wheels down at 7PM!

MEET UP: USS Maine National Monument, Columbus Circle
1849 Broadway, NY, NY 10023
http://goo.gl/maps/qUIEL

DESTINATION: Coney Island Beach and Boardwalk
Surf Ave and Stillwell Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11224
http://www.yelp.com/biz/coney-island-beach-and-boardwalk-brooklyn

ROUTE: TBA

DISTANCE: <18 Miles (one way)

We will do our best to stick together but please have someone’s number to call if you ride ahead and lose the group. There are a few stretches where everyone will be invited to pedal at their preferred pace and mass up points will be called out along the route…so grab your bike and bring your friends!

Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.
The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.

Feel free to contact us with any questions/concerns.
[masked]

CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.

WHAT YOU NEED:

NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.

Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!

HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6

REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.

Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
You are invited to a film screening and discussion on Friday, July 10th as part of Responsible Endowments Coalition's (REC) Summer Film Series--an initiative to promote political education and community discussion around pressing and relevant issues.

Co-sponsored by 350NYC, New York Society for Ethical Culture, and Bronx Climate Justice North, this event will feature “Disruption," a film by Kelly Nyks and Jared P. Scott. The movie explores the organizing work that led up to the People’s Climate March, the power of protest movements, and the issue of climate change through a social justice lens.

The program will start at 6:30pm on the 4th Floor of the New York Society for Ethical Culture (2 W 64th Street, New York, NY 10023). After the movie, we will have presentations by student leaders working on university fossil fuel divestment campaigns as well as community activists working on the New York City pension divestment campaign. We will discuss takeaways from the movie, their implications on fossil fuel divestment campaigns, and next steps for intergenerational, cross-campaign collaboration.

We hope to create an intimate, all-ages space that can provide networking opportunities for students, alumni, and community members in New York City. As movers, shakers, and doers with a shared vision of a sustainable and just world, we must come together to cultivate critical thought and proactively support each other’s efforts.

Food and drinks will be provided. We highly encourage attendees to make a 5 dollar donation, but no one will be turned away for lack of funds. Please RSVP to our Facebook event and share the event with your friends!

If you are unable to attend, you can watch out for future film screenings and new episodes in our ongoing political education video project.

Thank you and we look forward to seeing you all there!
Much love & power,
Nina Macapinlac
http://www.endowmentethics.org/
results.name: "Disruption" - Movie viewing & Discussion

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.name: After Work Singles Mixer! (NOW SOLD OUT FOR MEN)

results.description:
Click Here To Sign Up Online

                                                 From 6:30pm-10:00pm

                     **An RSVP on meetup.com will not reserve your spot**

Tired of waiting on long lines or showing up 3 hours early to a gym just to try and get a spot. Well wait no more!

With Big City you also get to play on the same team as your friends when you show up.

Sign-Up in advance to participate in Big City Volleyball's weekly Open Play Friday evenings from 7:00pm – 10:00pm at The High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street betw. 9th & 10th Avenue), one of our premier gyms with two courts, conveniently located just a few blocks from Columbus Circle.

Who Can Participate:
Intermediate to Advanced players only! Players must be able to handle a free ball, pass accurately, serve consistently and play bump-set-spike vball rather than just retuning the ball to the other side of the court. (In Big City that's Divisions 3, 4 & 5). If you cannot do the above, you will be asked to leave. You don't have to currently play in the league to participate.

Where:
High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street - between 9th & 10th Avenue)

When:
Friday evenings Sept Thru June.

Times:
6:30pm - 10:00pm
  How Much:
$15 per session On-line in advance.


(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)
Only players who register on-line will be guaranteed a spot.
Players who pay at the door will not be given a spot to play until all on-line registered players have been checked in and then only if space permits.
Players who pay in advance will lose their spot if they arrive after check-in is complete.
Players can register in advance as many people as they like per session.
Players can Register in advance for as many sessions as they like.
*Must be 21 years old to participate.
*Only 48 spots per session.
(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)

How It Works
Each court will have up to three teams of 8 players. games will be to 21 points rally scoring. Players will sub in on dead balls. If a team wins two games in a row they must sit one game.

Big City prides itself on friendly competition. Please play fair and maintain respectable behavior towards your teammates and opponents. Call your own violations! (Nets, Sets and Out Balls). If you are rude in any manner or raise your voice you will be asked to leave and not allowed to participate again.
                                      ***Click Here Sign-Up On-Line In Advance***
results.name: Big City Volleyball Co-Ed Friday Open Play!!!

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.

So What's A Bead Bash?
A Bead Bash is a singles mixer that is the perfect place to make new friends, have an absolute blast and possibly meet that special someone! Come on out and mingle while sipping cocktails, listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling and meet lots of fun, friendly single people!

This is a Multi-Meetup group event... Over 150 singles will be attending! The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual event attendees.

* Upon entering the event you will receive several beaded necklaces of one color...

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
We are reaching out to invite you to a film screening and discussion on Friday, July 10th as part of REC’s Summer Film Series--an initiative to promote political education and community discussion around pressing and relevant issues.

Co-sponsored by 350NYC, New York Society for Ethical Culture, and Bronx Climate Justice North, this event will feature “Disruption," a film by Kelly Nyks and Jared P. Scott. The movie explores the organizing work that led up to the People’s Climate March, the power of protest movements, and the issue of climate change through a social justice lens.

The program will start at 6:30pm on the 4th Floor of the New York Society for Ethical Culture (2 W 64th Street, New York, NY 10023). After the movie, we will have presentations by student leaders working on university fossil fuel divestment campaigns as well as community activists working on the New York City pension divestment campaign. We will discuss takeaways from the movie, their implications on fossil fuel divestment campaigns, and next steps for intergenerational, cross-campaign collaboration.

We hope to create an intimate, all-ages space that can provide networking opportunities for students, alumni, and community members in New York City. As movers, shakers, and doers with a shared vision of a sustainable and just world, we must come together to cultivate critical thought and proactively support each other’s efforts.

Food and drinks will be provided. We highly encourage attendees to make a 5 dollar donation, but no one will be turned away for lack of funds. Please RSVP to our Facebook event and share the event with your friends!

If you are unable to attend, you can watch out for future film screenings and new episodes in our ongoing political education video project.

Thank you and we look forward to seeing you all there!

Much love & power,
Nina Macapinlac
http://www.endowmentethics.org/
-=-=-
Responsible Endowments Coalition · United States
results.name: “Disruption" the movie + discussion +organizing + food!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Coney Island is the place to be this summer!  With all new attractions it is once again known as America's Playground!  Join us for this fun night where we team up with the folks from Quiet Events for a special edition Coney Island History and Party Tour.  We will have almost 100 people coming but you won't miss a thing because each person will get a pair of wireless headphones that will enable you to hear the history of Coney Island as well as enjoy 2 different channels of party music along the way!  Once at Coney Island the group will enjoy a history tour of  the area. Following the tour you can  enjoy activities like riding the Cyclone, Thunderbolt or Wonder Wheel. Try Bumper Cars, a dozen different games or just enjoy a cold drink at the Boardwalk Bar!  at 9:30pm there will be a huge fireworks display over the beach. The group will meet at The Playwright Irish Tavern on 35th street for happy hour, then travel on the subway together to Coney Island.

Check in Location: Playwright Irish Tavern
Check in time: 6:00 – 7:00pm
Leave at: 7:30 pm
Party ends: ~11pm @ Place to Beach Bar Coney Island

Limited spots (100)

Party Tour Highlights
• 2 Bars with drink specials
• Professional City Tour Guide
• Party in places you never did before (Train, boardwalk, and more..)
• Unique way to party and meet new friends
•$15 includes: drinks specials in 2 bars, professional tour guide, headphone rental, gratuity

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own

What to expect: 100 fun a friendly people looking to enjoy a unique night out

What to wear: summer casual/business casual if coming from work. Comfortable shoes

When does it end? The fireworks are over at 10pm.  You can stay at the bar with the group or leave anytime you'd like.

Can I meet the group in Coney Island?  Yes but you will need to contact [masked] to make arrangements.

What to bring: Metrocard for 2 trips

What if it rains? We will do the tour only if the weather allows.  We will contact you on the day of to keep you posted.

Age Restriction 21+

What you need
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $50. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling  in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into the organizer and you’ll receive your registration paper.  We end a bar in which the headphones are returned and you’re more then welcome to party till dawn.

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

This is a Multi-Meetup group event... Over 150 singles will be attending! The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual event attendees.

Here's how it works:

* Upon entering the event you will receive several beaded necklaces of one color...

* Your goal is to mingle with other singles at the event while getting as many different color beaded necklaces as you can from people of the opposite gender. They will also want to trade beads with you or ask to take some of yours. It's so much fun!

* If you can collect ten different colored beaded necklaces, come up to the event host wearing your beads and you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win one of a bunch of great prizes!

---> Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
---> Drink Specials!
---> Raffles To Win Great Prizes!
---> Typically 70% of  Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
---> Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s Welcome To Attend

Ticket Price: $15 (The next 10 people in the group to use discount code "BEADMEETUP" at checkout get this special Meetup price only for Meetup members). Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/beadbash.html

"The bead icebreaker is such a great, low pressure way to meet people! You get a chance to meet so many people throughout the whole night in a fun, relaxed way!" - Michelle, NY

WHEN: Friday, July 10th, 6:30 - 10:30 PM
WHERE: Ainsworth Park: Bar & Lounge - 111 E 18th St, New York, NY 10003

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/beadbash.html

results.name: After Work Singles Mixer!

results.description:
Let's go visit Yoko Ono's exhibit at MoMA.


The Museum of Modern Art presents its first exhibition dedicated exclusively to the work of Yoko Ono, taking as its point of departure the artist’s unofficial MoMA debut in late 1971. At that time, Ono advertised her “one woman show,” titled Museum of Modern [F]art. However, when visitors arrived at the Museum there was little evidence of her work. According to a sign outside the entrance, Ono had released flies on the Museum grounds, and the public was invited to track them as they dispersed across the city. Now, over 40 years later, Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960–1971 surveys the decisive decade that led up to Ono’s unauthorized exhibition at MoMA, bringing together approximately 125 of her early objects, works on paper, installations, performances, audio recordings, and films, alongside rarely seen archival materials. A number of works invite interaction, including Painting to Be Stepped On (1960/1961) and Ono’s groundbreaking performance, Bag Piece (1964). The exhibition draws upon the 2008 acquisition of the Gilbert and Lila Silverman Fluxus Collection Gift, which added approximately 100 of Ono’s artworks and related ephemera to the Museum’s holdings.

Join us for an evening of art and let's grab a drink afterwards :)

See you there!
results.name: Yoko Ono: One Woman Show at MoMA

results.name: Bead Bash Singles Mixer

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

<a>[masked]</a>

What's a Bead Bash: 
A Bead Bash is a fun & unique mixer to make new friends, have an absolute blast, and possibly meet that special someone! 

Upon entering the event you will receive several beaded necklaces of one color. 

Your goal is to mingle with other singles at the event while getting as many different color beaded necklaces as you can from people of the opposite gender. 

They will also want to trade beads with you or ask to take some of yours. It's so much fun!

Collect ten different colored beaded necklaces and come up to the event host wearing your beads and you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win great prizes! 

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "BEAD" at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/

What to expect: 

• Drink Specials 

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "BEAD" at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/ 

*THIS IS A PREPAY ONLY EVENT. MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE TO ATTEND. NO TICKETS SOLD AT DOOR. 

"The bead icebreaker is such a great, low pressure way to meet people! You get a chance to meet so many people throughout the whole night in a fun, relaxed way!" - Michelle, NY

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

PREPAY ONLY - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/

results.name: Bead Bash Singles Mixer (PREPAY ONLY) - SOLD OUT FOR MEN!

results.description:
Please join a fun group of people who are interested in a diverse mix of strategy, card, and party games.  We play games such as Ticket to Ride, Avalon, Hanabi, Pandemic, Tzolk'in and many others. 

We encourage you to bring your own games; there are always people looking to learn something new, as well as find a new favorite board game.

Mass Transit to this location is available by taking the Q54 bus or by the E-F-M-R train stop at 71st-Continental Ave then to the Q23 bus. 

You can purchase drinks, foods, and snacks, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks.  We want this restaurant to enjoy our presence! 

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us.  Newcomers are always welcome!

If you want to join our board game facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buy/sell games or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:


https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Forest Hills

* THIS IS NOT A JEWISH SPECIFIC EVENT. ALL ARE WELCOME TO ATTEND... HOWEVER A COUPLE OF JEWISH MEETUP GROUPS HAVE BEEN INVITED SO YOU CAN EXPECT SOME JEWISH SINGLES THERE.

So What's A Bead Bash?
A Bead Bash is a singles mixer that is the perfect place to make new friends, have an absolute blast and possibly meet that special someone! Come on out and mingle while sipping cocktails, listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling and meet lots of fun, friendly single people!

This is a Multi-Meetup group event... Over 150 singles will be attending! The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual event attendees.

Here's how it works:

* Upon entering the event you will receive several beaded necklaces of one color...

* Your goal is to mingle with other singles at the event while getting as many different color beaded necklaces as you can from people of the opposite gender. They will also want to trade beads with you or ask to take some of yours. It's so much fun!

* If you can collect ten different colored beaded necklaces, come up to the event host wearing your beads and you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win one of a bunch of great prizes!

Ticket Price: $15 (The next 10 people in the group to use discount code "BEADMEETUP" at checkout get this special Meetup price only for Meetup members).
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/beadbash.html

---> Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
---> Drink Specials!
---> Raffles To Win Great Prizes!
---> Typically 70% of  Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
---> Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s Welcome To Attend 

"The bead icebreaker is such a great, low pressure way to meet people! You get a chance to meet so many people throughout the whole night in a fun, relaxed way!" - Michelle, NY

results.description:
What's a Bead Bash:
A Bead Bash is a fun & unique mixer to make new friends, have an absolute blast, and possibly meet that special someone! 

Upon entering the event you will receive several beaded necklaces of one color. 

Your goal is to mingle with other singles at the event while getting as many different color beaded necklaces as you can from people of the opposite gender. 

They will also want to trade beads with you or ask to take some of yours. It's so much fun!

Collect ten different colored beaded necklaces and come up to the event host wearing your beads and you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win great prizes!

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "BEAD" at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/

What to expect: 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "BEAD" at checkout -  http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/

*THIS IS A PREPAY ONLY EVENT. MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE TO ATTEND. NO TICKETS SOLD AT DOOR.


"The bead icebreaker is such a great, low pressure way to meet people! You get a chance to meet so many people throughout the whole night in a fun, relaxed way!" - Michelle, NY

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/beadbash/

results.description:
**BRING YOUR OWN BEVERAGE TONIGHT:  It can be wine, coffee, soda, juice or water--whatever you would like.

LIGHT SNACKS will be served.  Be sure to get there on time or the snacks might be gone!

There will be FREE MUNICIPAL & FREE STREET PARKING After 6 PM.  

The ONLY CHARGE IS FOR THE POTTERY PIECE YOU CHOOSE TO PAINT, PLUS TAX. (No Sitting Fee!)  There's something there for everyone.  Even some projects for guys, too!  Your choice of which project to do.  THE STUDIO PH # OF ARTRAGEOUS IS: (516)[masked]

If you DON'T FINISH TONIGHT, you are welcome to take home your project and bring it back with you Next Time, to COMPLETE At NO Additional Charge.

** IF YOU WERE HERE TWO WEEKS AGO, YOUR MASTERPIECE SHOULD BE READY TO BE PICKED UP!  I can't wait to see them--Everyone did an awesome job!   

________________________________________________________

**IF I SIGNED YOU UP FOR TONIGHT, that's b/c you were on the waiting list from last time and wanted to give you a chance to go.  If you can't or don't want to attend, just change your RSVP or I can do it for you.  My cell # is [masked]-1386. 

We had lots of fun last time!  Great people were there, who are very talented!
results.name: Pottery Painting, Mosaic Projects & Fused Glass **Create your own** Join Us!

group.name: Hang Out in Queens and Nassau

results.description:
It was soo good, we have to repeat this event! The Dance Instructor, Cookie, had the whole CROWDED ROOM moving to beats within 5 minutes!  

(Lots of buffet food for $5 - you won't feel jipped! Last time, it was free snacks for every one! You pay for your drinks, of course.) See you there for some aerobics exercise!

*****************************

Copacabana (At the Copa)Song by 

Barry Manilow

Her name was Lola, she was a showgirl


With yellow feathers in her hair and a dress cut down to there


She would merengue and do the cha-cha


And while she tried to be a star, Tony always tended bar


Across a crowded floor, they worked from 8 till 4


They were young and they had each other


Who could ask for more?At the Copa (Copa!), Copacabana (Copacabana)


The hottest spot north of Havana (here)


At the Copa (Copa!), Copacabana


Music and passion were always the fashion


At the Copa, they fell in love His name was Rico, he wore a diamond...

*******************************************************

Friday night and you want to learn to dance salsa, but you are hungry and need to feast first. 

$5 include buffet for ladies (guys, sorry, it's $10 for you, sexism, I know! But you get to lead, and ladies get to wear high heel) ... and you'll be ready to hit the dance floor and follow slow step by step to learning Salsa basics. 

 https://copacabanany.com/event/june-5-after-work-fridays-the-copacabana-times-square/

And the best place to learn it would be at the heart of NYC at the FAMOUS COPACABANA (that famous song in your head yet?)

How easy is Salsa? Step with your toes first (when instructor say "foot") and count to 8. Easy to learn ... years to perfect. Every one's a beginner for at least 2 years, it seems. Let's start dancing!
results.how_to_find_us: meet outside near front door with your ID card by 645pm, or else pay the $10 admin fee after 7pm!
results.name: $5 buffet Dinner dressy Salsa Dancing (free class @ 7pm) @ Copacabana

group.name: ! New York Ethnic Food Lovers and activities

results.description:
Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Location:

Chelsea Studios

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

Ask for Chelsea Studios!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of ID. Go to the 6th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!

 

 

Thank you!

Japan Cultural Appreciation Group・日本文化友会

Contact / お問い合わせ先: [masked]

Website / ウェブサイト:

http://www.jcagny.org


Follow us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/groups/317147851698725/
results.name: Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange

results.description:
This would be the first meetup of the group. Let's get together for a meet and greet and dinner at Buckley's.


Since, this is our first meetup, let's greet each other at the bar and then we will grab seats for a casual dinner to learn more about each other.

Buckley's is a neighborhood, Irish American Tavern that has been around for more than 30 years. http://www.buckleyscaterers.com/


Let's meet at 7:00PM at the bar.

I will email each attendee my cell to make it easy for us to locate each other.

If for some reason, you're not able to make it, please change your RSVP.

Looking forward to meeting everyone and hearing your interest and ideas.
results.name: Marine Park Meet & Greet

results.description:
We are back again at PERRY'S RESTAURANT @ 3482 Nostrand Ave. between Ave. U and Ave. V on JULY 10TH from 7pm to 11pm.

We will be dining, dancing and enjoying the top notch entertainment of singer/DJ Barbara Lauren and Bobby V. 

Perry's can't be beat for value. You can purchase an entire dinner including soup or salad, appetizer, entree and dessert for under $25 plus tax and gratuity. A complimentary glass of wine is included. There is a $20 minimum  purchase for each guest during the dinner shows.

**There is ample free on site parking.

There may be more games. Still time to RSVP and join us.

results.description:
Visit: http://www.adelanteartistsgallery.com/michelle-lee-ghisson-1.html


My work is driven by a constant examination and preservation of personal memories. My paintings describe these moments, the details of which are imparted in layers of paint. Most recently I've been thinking of the word Impermanence and what or how that idea can be embedded into my paintings. How are memories preserved and how do these recollections sometimes form confusing or false memories? After the actual experience of particularly very painful moments, our very existence relies often on changing and molding the memory into a more palatable or manageable one, something we can cope with better, understand and compartmentalize. I consider these recollections as layers of information, each level imparting bits of knowledge crucial to our consciousness, our ability to cope and even as a means of understanding our own mortality. This information and the concept of Impermanence comes to the surface and either sticks or fades away to different levels of opacity. Many times in remembering, I have personally buried the ugly and preserved the beautiful as a way of coping. I believe that I have created the same process in my art. When I am painting, the progression of remembering a specific moment over and over again from actually experiencing the event or sense from some unexplainable source helps structure the paintings. Some areas will be recognizable, while others will fade away into abstract thoughts of textures, forms, and colors. Other information I recall while I work has a deeper and unexplainable place that it comes from, call it intuition or instinct, these are all moments that I see as my truth unfolding onto a canvas. The surfaces of my paintings are very important to me. Color is also another significant element and is very specific to the actual memory. The process of scraping away layers of the oil paint and building them back up again is something that has added another level of information to consider in relationship to the act of painting and the concept of working from memories. Scarring or incising into the canvas, cutting, mending, adding found objects of antique thread and fabrics all contain a special meaning and relate to the preservation of my personal memories. ***

Michelle Ghisson lives and works in Erie, PA. She was initially trained as a painter, earning her BFA, MA and her MFA from Edinboro University of Pennsylvania. Ghissons work is included in the permanent collection at Ednboro University of PA. She is currently working in her studio where she is using familial artifacts that she embeds into her work by layering items of antique threads and fabrics with oil paint that she mixes to a thick impasto and trowels on with various tool she makes herself. Recently Ghisson has begun to scar the canvas and mend with antique threads from her various family member. Her work is said to be, Breathtaking Trans-formative and Meaningful.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
