results.description:
Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.

Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance that requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is called with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Our caller for July will be Bob Isaacs and the band is David Sidman's Elastic Band. Kenny Kosek, the fiddler for July 10th, has played with the likes of Laurie Anderson, Steve Goodman, John Denver, James Taylor, Jerry Garcia, Loudon Wainwright III and now he's playing for you. Village Contra favorite Joe de Paolo will be on percussion to set the beat and keep you going on the dance floor.


Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.

For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.

results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Our little group has grown to 935 members! Thanks to everyone! I'm excited to announce our next meetup, and I think it will be the best one yet. We'll be hanging out at Threes Brewing on Friday, July 10th starting at 7PM. This is an actual working brewery and bar, and although less than a year old, they're already making some of the best beer in NYC. They always have a bunch of their own beer on tap, and they fill their remaining lines with awesome craft beer. There might even be a surprise or two for us!

Threes has been nice enough to offer group members an extended happy hour: we'll get $1 off every drink from 7-8PM. There's also a backyard if the weather is nice.

A first for us, there will be great food too, so feel free to have dinner! Threes has been doing a 'rotating kitchen residency' since they opened, where food is cooked by some of the best restaurants in the city. So far they've had The Farm on Adderley, Insa Korean BBQ, Mimi's Hummus, Roberta's Pizza, The Sussman Brothers, Ruccola, Mile End, The Meat Hook, and Delaney BBQ. For us, Dover and Battersby, two great restaurntas in the Cobble Hill area, will be providing the food.


A quick note, this bar gets crowded, so it's best to arrive on the early side. Plus, more time to enjoy our discount!


Let me know if you have any questions or concerns. Hope to see all 935 of you there!

Eric
results.name: Let's Drink Awesome Beer at Threes Brewing!

results.description:
GENERAL DIS-ASSEMBLY NIGHT

Once a month we are putting together a night of pure DESTRUCTION!!!!! (Evil laugh).  The goal is simple, grab a item off the surplus shelf, strip it bare of all salvageable parts (screws, nuts, bolts, springs, clamps, motors, sensors, circuit boards, etc.) and discard the remains.   We are looking to increase our parts inventory while also decreasing our surplus.  It's a great opportunity to pear inside the magic of electronic's and learn about different components.  Join us tonight for pure DESTRUCTION at its best. Free and open to the public.

WARNING: Plan ahead, wear comfortable clothes that you don't mind getting messy, and be prepared to get dirty!

 

OPEN CRAFT NIGHT Continues:

Come make stuff! Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about.

results.description:
**MEETUP RSVP IS NOT A TICKET**

Happy Hour is at The Wright, 7pm to 9pm, cash bar/food. Members only. 

More about Art After Dark: http://www.guggenheim.org/new-york/calendar-and-events/series/art-after-dark


F.A.Q

1. Can I still buy a regular ticket? 

Sorry, but General Admission tickets are sold out. Tickets will not be sold at the door. The only way in now is to buy a Guggenheim membership:  https://ny.guggenheim.org/live-pages/guggenheim.org/10off-nycsw (you have to buy via a desktop computer. it appears the discount doesn't work on mobile devices)

2. If I buy a membership, do I still need to pay to get into Art After Dark? 

No. Your discounted membership includes free admission to all Guggenheim special events for the next year, including all future Art After Dark events!

Please note that Individual level Guggenheim Museum members are admitted for free to Art After Dark. A total of two people may enter for free on each membership at the Dual level and above. Members and their guests may enter the event through the Fifth Avenue entrance. Presale ticket buyers may enter the event at 2 E 89th Street. For more information, contact the Membership Department at <a>[masked]</a> or [masked].


3. Does my +1 need membership? 

Yes. If you are 2 people, then you each of you need a Guggenheim membership. At this point, if you dont already have a general admission ticket, the only way to get in is with a membership. Plus, you can join us at our happy hour at the Wright (inside the museum) and not have to wait outside till the doors open. 

4. How do I get into the happy hour? 

If you bought a membership, you are all set. Make sure you have your membership confirmation/receipt so they can look you up. Happy hour is at The Wright (7PM - 9PM). Members only. 

5. If I am already a Guggenheim Member,  can I attend the happy hour? 

Yes! Drop your name here and we will reply back once we verify your membership with the Guggenheim. https://goo.gl/b8soEA

Corporate members are not granted free admission unless they have the card with the Corporate Courtesy Card label on it. If they aren’t sure, please have them contact Victoria Liu, Manager, Corporate Membership at <a>[masked]</a> at [masked], or they can contact their employee benefits manager to clarify the status of their company’s card.

To get more information on membership perks and to purchase your discounted membership here: https://ny.guggenheim.org/live-pages/guggenheim.org/10off-nycsw

New York City is an amazing place to be during the Spring and Summer. We are fortunate to live in a city where there is no shortage of cultural events during these warmer months. From the River to River Festival to Shakespeare in the Park to Electronic Daisy Carnival, there is something for everyone. One of our favorite seasonal events is Art After Dark at the internationally renowned art museum and one of the most significant architectural icons of the 20th century, the Guggenheim Museum. For those that have never been, imagine enjoying a cocktail then walking through the Guggenheim with hip-hop grooves playing in the background by DJ mOma. Sounds awesome, right? 


So together with the Guggenheim, we are inviting our Startup Weekend community to not only skip the lines for After After Dark but also join us for happy hour inside their restaurant, The Wright. Get your exclusive discounted Guggenheim Membership and enjoy pre-event cocktails at the Wright with us. And once the doors open at 9PM, we can make our way directly into the museum for Art After Dark. 


Take advantage of $10 savings and join us as our special guest for this after-hours private viewing of current exhibitions, including Storylines: Contemporary Art from the Guggenheim Collection and Doris Salcedo. As you move through the galleries, the museum will fill with the sounds of a live set by Queens, New York-based DJ mOma featuring a blend of funk, soul, R&B, disco, house, hip-hop, reggae, world music, and underground dance grooves mixed with classic jams, rare gems, and current favorites.
results.name: Art After Dark with The Guggenheim and Startup Weekend [COST: $65]

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you very much.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. Thank you.

Description: The organizer will provide much commentary. The Upper West Side has many architecturally distinctive and magnificent apartment buildings. We’ll discuss the architectural style and social history of some of these apartment buildings, built from 1880 to 1932. We’ll discuss apartment buildings that have had a scandalous past; others that have had a spiritual beginning. We’ll look at apartment houses built for the wealthy, tenements built for the poor, studio buildings built for artists, and buildings that were not originally built as apartment houses.

This is a walking tour. We'll be walking about 2 1/2 miles. There will be a number of stops at points of interest. If you don't like a lot of stopping, then this type of walk is not good for you.

Although the Ansonia is still decorated with magnificent ornamentation, it originally had even more ornamentation. During 1942, the Ansonia’s copper cornices were removed and melted down for the war effort. (Photo Library of Congress [Detroit Publishing Company circa 1905])

Workmen removing a cartouche from the roof of the Ansonia Hotel. (Source Lorraine B. Diehl, 1942])

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you very much. 

Meeting Time/Place:  The meeting time is (after dinner) at 7:15 PM. The meeting place is outside the entrance to Barnes & Noble at 2289 Broadway, near 82nd St. Before the walk, restrooms are available on the second floor of Barnes & Noble.

Transportation: Take the No.1 subway local train to 79th St and Broadway. 

Finishing Time/Place:  The walk finishes about 9:40 PM at West 78th Street. This walking tour will last about 2 hours and 15 minutes.

Rainy weather cancels the walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Friday. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place.


Below is a photo of a man sunbathing on the ledge of an Upper West Side building. (Photo Laura Rosen)

Below is a photo of a woman sunbathing on the mansard roof of an Upper West Side building. The mansard roof has two-slopes and the top slope (not as steep as the lower slope) is usually not seen from the street. Unlike a flat roof, the Mansard's top slope , which is not too steep, allows water to run off the roof.(Photo Laura Rosen)
results.name: Upper West Side Walking Tour at Sunset (July 10)

results.description:
The Friday night iftaar our normal venue has been a tradition for a number of years, usually carried out under the NY Progressive Muslim Meetup. However, we are going to take up the banner this year. Join us starting with the second Friday.


Someone will be at the location around 7:30. The fast will open at around 8:32 pm. As usual, we'll have a communal prayer followed by food. We request a $5-10 donation towards the cost of hosting the iftaars. All excess funds collected will be donated to charity. Typically, community members choose to sponsor part or all of the iftaars. If you are interested, please contact any of the organizers via email.

Please note that we do have limited space, so please RSVP only if you plan to attend. We do not charge a deposit for attendance, so it's really important, especially for iftaars that require pre-planning, that if you change your mind or something comes up, that you change your attendance on the site, to allow for others to take your place.
results.name: Ramadan Iftaar

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Friday Night? This event Friday night is for men and women at Nirvana.

At present we need both men and women aged 33 to 43 although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  The theme tonight is speed dating those with advanced degrees (i.e. JD, MBA, Master's, PhD etc..)


Grab friends and come along to Nirvana to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>).  But if you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website (you also can signup there anytime in case I don't respond back with promo code MEETUP20). Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel

results.description:
What better way to spend a summer evening - eating frozen treats and singing with a circle of friends, known or yet to know.


All kinds of "ice cream" and toppings to enjoy, true ice cream and ice (no)cream. There is the singing and playing, sweet songs, bawdy songs, murder ballads, singers' choice. 

You bring your appetite for frozen delights and melodious sounds for a song swap hosted by Frank Woerner, leader of our Brooklyn Open Sings. Bring instruments, voices, kids, friends and songs; have a great time. Prepare a song or tune to lead, sing/play along, tap your feet, or relax and listen. Harmonies and chorus songs appreciated.


Contribution $10; children under 12, $5

results.description:
The First Friday Night Rip of July!  Come out to Prospect Park and join us for a fun night of skating, hanging!

We’ll be gathering at the rip spot in on the South West side of Prospect park at 8pm and skating, downhilling and sliding one of our favorite spots.  We will have a bit of swag and maybe even a few contests! Bring your board, your helmet, your moves and your friends.  It’s going to be a great time! 


The First Friday Night Rip series is a long tradition of Brooklyn skaters.  The first friday of the month there will be a host from the meetup group and will  be there from 8pm - 10pm.  We will be just inside Prospect Park from the intersection of 16th street and Prospect Park South West.

• Please make sure to bring your helmet, you are responsible for your own safety. 


Sorry for the delay of this event, due to the holiday weekend at the beginning of the month, we have pushed this back to the 10th of July!

Monthly series: 1st Friday of every month.

Free and open to public.

July film: Annie Hall (1977) [PG]

Because of the holiday weekend, July's "first Friday" film will be held on Juy 10th. Hailed as Woody Allen's most mature and personal film, Annie Hall beat out Star Wars for Best Picture and also won Oscars for Allen as director and writer and for Keaton as Best Actress. results.description:
What to Expect.
Relax. It's Easy.

 

Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

 

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

 

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Dance totally changed my life and literally saved me! When i was on the edge of abyss, everything seemed so black and i was loosing myself, this is when i found the way towards the light, towards the Love and found my true self! Dance became my prayer, my meditation and my sanctuary!Darkness is not something we need to afraid of, without it, you cant see the light. What hurts you blesses you! It brings the candle which never gets burn and shines in your life always!
Through the Dance i learned how to love unconditionally and have compassion towards all living beings. How to live in my heart and in my spirit!

Dance is more than we think it is. It is simply a meditation where you move from your head to your body and spirit and leave everything behind, let go who we think we are, and embracing your true self! You wanna climb on the mountain?
Climb, while you dance.
You wanna Fight with your obstacles?
Fight with a dance.
Dance at the edge of the abyss.
Dance your sadness,
Dance your pain,
Dance your cry,
Dance your fear!
Allow yourself to feel curious to feel sadness to feel pain to feel everything that comes to you. Allow yourself to be loud, to scream, to laugh... Allow all of ur qualities good or bad.... Embrace them, and let go the things you need to let go,
Let yourself feel free! And Just Dance.......Let your spirit Dance.
Feel the lightness, weightiness when you Dance.
Express yourself fully, Leave All the stories you created about yourself behind...
Now go deep down to your soul....
And tell your true story by your spiri

results.description:
The Color Run is a five-kilometer, un-timed race in which thousands of participants, or “Color Runners”, are doused from head to toe in different colors at each kilometer. With only two rules, the idea is easy to follow: 


1) Wear white at the starting line. 2) Finish plastered in color! The fun continues after Color Runners complete the race with an unforgettable Finish Festival. This larger than life party is equipped with music, dancing and massive color throws.


This sounds like the perfect laid back 5K for us to try out first! We can register as a team as long as we have 4 or more participants ($45 per person until June 15th, $50 afterwards).

Register here (let's choose the Friday, July 10th 9:15 PM Run/Walk/Dance/Cartwheel/Party Wave option): http://thecolorrun.com/night/brooklyn/

**Team: BFHFF (password: meetup)**


Find more info on the race here: http://thecolorrun.com/night/brooklyn/

Can't wait, ladies!!

Mbali

(cell:[masked])
results.name: Brooklyn Color Run Night (aka "The Happiest 5K on the Planet!")

results.description:
American Bolero Dance Company brings its popular performance series, Tablao Flamenco, back to The Chian Federation in Astoria, Queens on July 10th. Since 2008, Tablao Flamenco has been showcasing world-class artists from around the NYC and abroad performing live Flamenco and other styles of Spanish dance and music. Presented like a cabaret, where guests can order and enjoy food and drinks during the show, Tablao Flamenco re-creates the experience of being in one of Spain’s flamenco clubs (or 'tablaos') but for local audiences.

Featuring:
GABRIELA GRANADOS - dancer
JOSE MORENO - dancer
CRISTINA DE JOSE - dancer
AURORA REYES - singer/dancer
BASILIO GEORGES - guitarist
CRISTIAN PUIG - guitarist
and
the BALLET ESPANOL de GABRIELA GRANADOS.

Where:
The Chian Federation
44-01 Broadway (at 44th Street)
Astoria, NY 11103
By subway: R or M to the 46th Street station

Admission:
Adults $25; Seniors $20; Children (under 12 years old) $15.

Please Note:
Food and drinks available for order – not included in the ticket price.
Assigned table seating (you can choose your own seats if you order online at BPT).
Doors to the venue open at 6:30 PM for the start of seating and service. Show begins at 8:30 PM.

Ticket sales and more information:
Via Brown Paper Tickets:
http://ABDCTablao7-10-15.BrownPaperTickets.com
Phone orders (24/7) at[masked]

American Bolero Dance Company:
http://www.ambolero.com
(718)[masked] or (917)[masked]

Follow this event on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/445836068954074/

The Summer 2015 “Tablao Flamenco” series is made possible (in part) by the Queens Council on the Arts, with public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs, in partnership with the City Council, and with funds from the Decentralization Program, a regrant program of the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the New York State Legislature and administered by the Queens Council on the Arts.

results.description:
Hi all, this is comment I put on a discussion of Greece.   I'll ad more to what may be the digital currency implications. 

 ----------------- comment  

 I think Greece will go. I think they should go.  Some economist have it that in the short term Greece will have it bad, but in the long term it will become better. Most hear, how bad it be, but they don't say it becomes better. It's because you hit rock bottom, only place is to go is up.  If you keep the debt, you languish on the lower tear -- not all the way to the bottom, but much lower than the middle.   People who filed bankruptcy, have more money after freeing up from debt payments.     

  But, for EU it will look real bad, there are I think 3 or 4 other EU nations that have debt problems.  If their government change and votes to renegotiate their debt, it becomes a domino effect to unravel everything.   EU bonds will suffer before that happens and after if Greece leaves, but they wonder who will be next.  Euro will drop in value.  To keep it from falling, ECB will have to raise interest rates. If they do that, it will slow down what economic grow they had. In fact it will worsen the poorer EU nations economic condition because it will slow down their economy even worse.  Then for USA, because euro is worth less, they can't sell as much to Europe.  Therefore what little economic recovery USA had will go down the drain.  Europe is their 2nd best trade partner. The question will be then, will the USA open their balance sheet of US treasury bonds to print more money so they can lower the value of their currency so they can trade with EU competitively.  If that happens, Japan will have to do same. So on and so on -- nations around the globe will do the same.  The domino effects will keep on going, where it stops, will someone know, except for God, almighty.           

  So although Greece GDP may be small, this tiny rock can turn into a boulder quickly and who is going to stop it?

------------------- End of comment -------------

                  Ok,  this currency balancing and unbalancing may have no end, once the Greece bomb hits.  The moving and maneuvering  of currency of different country will have no end.  For some will start looking for stabling factors.  That is the key to business -- steady and stable.  In this equation the problem is the many parts will keep changing their currency. What you need is a commonality where most will use, so that the abundant use of one currency or what most currency is backed by will not keep changing.  In my opinion, they will need to back up their currency to a commonality that all can or most can agree on.  Usually business people sticks to what is stable.   Interesting enough, that's where gold came in handy back then.  It was not that gold was used for money, but most nations accepted it and agreed on it.   

                  So this will give an opening for digital currency, or for that matter anything that may be stable, if this really does become "Currency Apocalypse".   They may grab for bitcoins.  So far, it has been steady at 200 -300 most of the year.    

                 On a side track there is the oil effect with the USA.  Saudis can't sell oil to China, because China and Russia will only trade in currency that is not US dollars.  This loses business for Saudis since they agreed with USA to trade only in dollars.   That is important because if the Saudis do decide to trade in other currencies, which I believe they'll do because USA oil producers are competing with them,  the USA dollar may drop because of lose of demand.    But by how much?  Do you know, according to Forbes,  the US fed have already bought trillions of US bonds and it is in their balance sheet, for economic recovery.  How will they sell off these bonds without higher interest rates to make them more attractive?  The world won't want US dollars as much, if they can buy oil with other currencies.  You add China's AIIB, BRICS, incentives to use  non-US currency to do global transaction, the US dollar demand may plummet even more. 

There are so many factors in today's currencies that many may not be able to predict what will happen.  Most should agree, it is an unprecedented times we are living in.
results.name: Online:Is Greece bomb Currency Apocalypse ?

results.description:
PMJAMNITES
----------------------

is an event held every 2ND & LAST FRIDAY of the month to attract & showcase local talent and create an artistically social event. Artists pre-sign up to perform and are delegated a slot to perform . Designated Artists are featured and showcased .

PMJAMNITES LIVE MUSIC  begins at 9:00 pm thru 12:00 am

PLAYMUSICIAN

-----------------------
For more Info / news / pics / videos Visit :- Facebook.com/PMJAMNITES

PlayMusician provides a platform for artists, both upcoming and established, to showcase their talent, ranging from singer /songwriters , photographers, comediens, dancers, solo artists, spoken-word/poetry, full bands and more..

We promote local artists and musicians by creating musical events with eclectic themes and showcasing them. Seasoned artists are matched with up and coming artists.

We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists, and eventually becoming a staple in the community.

An artist’s passion is what we hope to support and encourage. It’s an artist community or family that we hope to grow through our events, website, social media and personal networking.

We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues .
Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

WWW.FACEBOOK.COM/PMJAMNITES
WWW.PLAYMUSICIAN.COM/

ARTS . COMMUNITY . EVENTS

Facebook ADD : "playmusician"
Please "Like" playmusician/PMJAMNITES on facebook.

results.description:
This summer, we would like to try to host some late night photowalks and execute some long exposures.  Weather permitting, we will meet on the side of the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory.  Nearest subways are York Street (F), Clark Street (2,3) and High Street (A,C).

We will begin by capturing some long exposures of the cityscape from Brooklyn Bridge Park for about an hour.  Then we will cross the Brooklyn Bridge and make a pit stop at City Hall.  We'll head towards South Street Seaport for some long exposures at the pier for about 20-30 minutes.  Then we will continue our walk along South Street; maybe stop by Wall Street for some architecture, and our last stop will be at the National Museum of the American Indian -- by the Bowling Green subway station.

***********************************

Items to bring: 

 
* Camera -- along with charged battery and empty memory card 

 
* Tripod -- PLEASE READ THIS; IMPORTANT!!!! --  We've done long exposures in the past and so far we had no issues. Just bringing up the possibilities so that everyone is aware -- Tripods ARE NOT ALLOWED TO BE USED on the bridge.  If you have a monopod, or a mini tripod, you could probably use those.  Keep in mind that the bridge may still be quite crowded with tourists, joggers and cyclists, so stay on the correct path of the bridge. Also, you may be stopped by police or security for using a tripod & be asked for a permit.  Just move along.    So, you have been warned. 

 
* Remote -- this is OPTIONAL.  If you want to shoot longer than 30 seconds aka bulb mode, a remote is a good idea. 

 
* Bring snacks & water to stay hydrated.

***********************************

* Be on time! This event starts at 9pm sharp!! So give yourself plenty of time to travel. Check for service changes or delays. I will not wait for latecomers and I will not answer calls, emails and/or messages after 9pm.

* Dress appropriately for the weather and wear comfortable shoes.

* Food and restrooms are located in the Brooklyn Bridge Park area if you want to arrive earlier to eat and drink.  After that, you gonna have to hold it... :P

* DO NOT WANDER OFF IN THE DARK BY YOURSELF WITH YOUR EXPENSIVE EQUIPMENT!!!  YOU'LL JUST BE ASKING SOMEONE TO HURT YOU AND STEAL FROM YOU.  ALWAYS WALK WITH SOMEONE OR A SMALL GROUP!!!!

Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are. 


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927) 

******************** 

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
Ladies,
Come out and enjoy a evening if art after dark. Not to often do you get a chance to get dressed up, meet new friends and get in some art viewing. There will be a cash bar that serves wine and beer and did u forget a DJ providing additional entertainment.

For more information- www.guggenheim.org

Access the events and calendar to locate the event on July 10.

As you move through the galleries, the museum will fill with the sounds of a live set by Queens, New York-based DJ mOma. He blends funk, soul, R&B, disco, house, hip-hop, reggae, world music, and underground dance grooves mixed with classic jams, rare gems, and current favorites. He has shared the stage with DJ legends Tony Humphries, Q-Tip, DJ Spinna, Just Blaze, Pete Rock, Evil Dee, Rich Medina, Felix da Housecat, and Tony Touch. mOma has DJed events for Drake, Rihanna, Solange Knowles, Kendrick Lamar, John Legend, Janelle Monae, Jennifer Hudson, Estelle, D'Angelo, and Erykah Badu. In addition, he is the official DJ for the Dreamville record label founded by rapper J Cole.

Cash bar serves wine and beer. Guests wishing to purchase alcoholic beverages will be asked for a photo ID. A bar menu will be available at The Wright starting at 7 pm.

Free for members, $25 general admission. Purchase tickets online in advance or become a member.

No tickets will be sold at the door.

Please Please purchase your tickets before they are sold out!!!

Hope to see you there!!
This meet up is open to males, feel free to bring a date or a male friend.

results.description:
We all know that the '80s & '90s had some of the best music of all time! But which decade had the songs that can still make your feet move? That very question will be answered at NYC's famous Cutting Room as one of the top cover bands and DJ face off! 

DJ Body Rock will be representing the '80s, spinning music from Michael Jackson, Madonna, Prince and more.  

Stifler's Mom, one of the biggest cover bands in the tri-state will pay homage to the last decade of the 20th century with its very own "Band Camp" horn section. 

With grunge hits from Pearl Jam, ska from No Doubt, pure pop from the Spice Girls, hip-hop from The Notorious B.I.G. and more, Stifler's Mom gets the party going with props, crazy costumes, movie clips, sound bites and plenty of other GenX/Y madness. 

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT (MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE) 

Limited # of tickets available for just $15 with discount code "8090" here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/8090710/

*WE  ONLY HAVE A FEW # OF TICKETS LEFT SO GET YOUR TICKET ASAP!  THIS IS GUARANTEED TO SELL OUT! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8K4H2b5eSDs

This is a Multi-Meetup so the # of RSVPs here do not reflect the total # of attendees.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the box office

***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
To Support This Campaign Click Here

Along with Marcus Garvey, Booker T. Washington helped set the template for other Business Networking groups today, including our own Black Business Support Network. 

http://youtu.be/4Q32-B6UPL4

To Support This Campaign Click Here

A 'tasty' new drama ~"Booker T Washington of Tuskegee, Alabama, dined with the President (Roosevelt) last evening."~ the White House.

THIS is a GREAT idea by any measure, too little is known of this GIANT in the mist/fog of OUR-story.

In addition to all his well known accomplishments, Book T. Washington formed an organization called the "National Negro Business League".Along with Marcus Garvey he help set the template for other Business Networking groups today, including our own Black Business Support Network. The difference being we are doing it in the age of the Internet; and they did it in a time when ANY aspirations voiced by non-white people was meet with the MOST extreme forms of Terrorism.

Real Talk, NO BS--

To Support This Campaign Click Here

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend! PLEASE NOTE THIS WEEK'S MEETUP IS ON SATURDAY, NOT SUNDAY!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee! 

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone
results.name: Let's talk!

results.description:
Once thought to be the tallest peak in the Catskills, this beautiful mountain provides amazing views of both the Hudson Valley and the Catskill interior wilderness. Bonus-we'll look for one of the 2 old plane crashes!

We'll pick you up in your choice of either Brooklyn or Manhattan, feed you breakfast (coffee included!) and delicious lunch, provide great company and knowledge of the area and its' wonders, take plenty of photos, and bring you home with a new experience and a sense of pride. We usually stop for a post-hike congratulatory dinner at a local favorite gastropub along the way back to NYC, depending on how everyone's feeling.

MEETUP MEMBERS GET 35% OFF! Just enter code MUP35 at checkout.

Book this adventure here: http://j.mp/hikekatterskill
results.name: Hike Katterskill High Peak!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday-@west 134th Street Field - 7:30am

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
HIKING, ICE CAVES, BLUEBERRY PICKING </a> The Northern <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawangunk_Ridge">Shawangunk Ridge was once home to a lively seasonal community of Berry Pickers who made their living foraging the wild blueberries which thrive along the wind-swept heights of what is now Minnewaska State Parkand Sam’s Point Preserve. Things To Do

Black bears, bobcats, foxes, fishers, timber rattlesnakes, and spotted salamanders can all be found at Sam's Point. While not as fuzzy as a fox or as far traveled as a migratory songbird, Sam's Point is still a haven for some amazingly rare and endangered plants and flowers.

Home to nearly 40 rare plants and animals and three rare natural communities, the Northern Shawangunks represent one of the highest priorities for conservation in the northeastern United States.  So, whether you consider yourself a first-rate birder or a just a novice at wildlife identification, you're bound to find something out-of-the ordinary at Sam's Point.

More than 200 species of migratory and nesting birds call Sam's Point home.  With binoculars in tow, you're sure to see some tiny warblers or flycatchers flitting about.  Larger birds can be seen as well, like hawks, falcons, vultures, and ravens.

ICE CAVES....We will be hiking also, LOL  to the WORLD FAMOUS ICE CAVES !!!!

<a href="http://www.tripadvisor.com/LocationPhotos-g47549-d2249193-Sam_s_Point_Preserve-Cragsmoor_New_York.html"></a>
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO KNOW:

There will be a Van to take you to the Mountain and return to NYC.

Fees:  $40.00 round trip transportation, when we arrive at the park there is a few dollars admission fee. Wear comfortable cross trainers or hiking boots, bring something to take blueberries home with, like plastic container tupper-ware etc...

We will be having lunch on the mountain, so you need to pack in Breakfast and Lunch!  More details to follow...

when it the van sells out, we will have no more room for NYC Commuters!.. RSVP Now!

George

group.name: Fit and Fun and Active Singles

results.description:
Only few of us hiked on this trail.  It is time to go back there again.   If you don't have plans that day,  please join me and sign up on the waiting list and once we have a car spot for you I'll move you to the "yes" column. Don't forget to answer two question when you sign on the waiting list. The number of participants will be limited to 20 people and by the number of cars we have to carpool.

This hike will be 10.4 challenging miles. The first half of this hike is constant up or down, the second has more level areas. You need to be in good shape before trying this hike. Several steep climbs are involved as well as one long descent that’s sure to leave your legs quivering from the exertion. We will climb and descend four mountains – Windbeam, Bear, Board, and Harrison – to take in views of the surrounding mountains as well as the Wanaque and Monksville Reservoirs. Also scramble over Tory Rocks.

Please try to leave NYC at around 8 a.m. on Saturday. Cars will meet at Stonetown Recreation Complex parking lot which is about 40 miles west of NYC Off I-287 exit 55.  The time to meet at the parking lot is around 9:15 a.m. Reason that we need to get there so early, hike will take about 6 - 8 hours depending on our pace.

Parking: RT 287 to exit 55, take 511 N (Wanaque), continue through Wanaque for several miles. Make a left onto West Brook Rd. Continue across Reservoir. At the T-intersection, make a right onto Stonetown Rd. and turn left on Mary Roth Drive which ends at the Stonetown Recreation Area with a large parking lot.

You need to bring at minimum 2 liters of water. Also bring a lunch snack, sunblock, sunglasses, and rain gear. The trail can be hiked in any good shoes, though boots are preferred.

Please bring money to pay driver for gas & toll ($10-$20 per person).  If we decide to go out for dinner after the hike., please also bring extra cash.

I will bring a map, a compass, and a first aid kit. Post a comment or e-mail me if you have any questions.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

I am in negotiation with them, detail will not be finalize until Monday.

DESCRIPTION:

The New York Bartending Schools FREE hands-on bartending class is a great way to learn cocktail recipes and show off you mixology skills on your next party. It is also a great way to see their facilities and talk to their staff, without any sale pressure or obligations. This free 2 hour class will allow you to get behind the bar and experience bartending and mixing drinks first-hand. The First 30 minutes will be demonstration. The next 1 hour and a half will be hands on Cocktails Mixology.

LEVEL: beginner

COCKTAILS: Please note drink menu may change.

Watermelon Slice Cocktail Recipe:
*1 oz  kiwi syrup
*2 oz  lemonade ( slightly concentrated, see note )
*1 ½ oz  vodka
*1 ½ oz  fresh watermelon juice

FIRE FAIRY
* 1 oz Amaretto
* 1/2 oz Absinthe
* 1 can of Red Bull

Crazy Parrot recipe
* 1 1/2 oz Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay coconut rum
* 3/4 oz 151 proof rum
* 2 oz pineapple juice
* 1 1/2 oz cranberry juice

Blueberry Gin
* 2 c. Gin
* 2 c. frozen blueberries
* 1/4 c. sugar zest of 1 lemon
* 2 whole cloves
* 1/2 inch piece of a cinnamon stick

Blue Monday
* 1 1/2 oz vodka
* 1/2 oz Cointreau® orange liqueur
* 1/4 oz Blue Curacao liqueurBlue Monday

REFERENCE:

• https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cocktail&redirect=no

• http://www.yelp.com/biz/new-york-bartending-school-new-york

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

END

results.description:
Rollins Pond should be at the top of your list if you like canoes, rowboats, paddle boats or kayaks. All are available for rent at the boat launch livery site, and this long narrow body of water provides the ideal setting for days of fun as you take turns on all of them. Adventurer's can canoe the waterway leading to Fish Creek, or just try their luck fishing in Whey Pond, located adjacent to the livery area, and "stocked" annually with trout.

Rollins Pond Campground is located on the eastern shore of 442 acre Rollins Pond. Camping equipment from tents to 40' RVs can be accommodated. Rollins Pond Campground offers a variety of recreational opportunities including: Canoeing and boating, fishing, hiking, and bicycling.

Amenities

287 campsites, accommodating all equipment from tents to 40' RV's, hot showers, flush toilets, firewood sales, trailer dumping station, boat launch (25 HP or under), boat and canoe rentals, hiking trails, and volleyball. There are no day-use facilities. Campers may use the day-use facilities at adjoining Fish Creek Pond Campground. * Please take note that at facilities that offer swimming beaches, there are days which lifeguards are unavailable. For the safety of our customers, these beaches will not be open and swimming will be prohibited

After you have made your reservation, please tell me what site you have reserved, right now we are in the Fish Camp Area on site 40.

HOW TO MAKE A RESERVATION: [b]Go to: www.reserveamerica.com and create an account.[/b]

[b] Pet Policy –Pet are allowed please review the policy on the Reserve America Site[/b]

results.description:
Join us for a free Brief SCUBA Orientation Session! This orientation should help answer your questions about learning to dive and is conveniently located at our Dive Center in Paramus. 

Who should attend?

• Anyone interested in becoming a SCUBA Diver.

• Anyone who has thought about it, but wants to know how it works

• Anyone who has Tried it and liked it

• Anyone who wants to start in the pool tomorrow.


The orientation session is recommended prior to participation in the Beginner SCUBA Open Water Course. During the orientation you can complete all the necessary course paper work, including a medical history form, and review course logistics and schedule. To finish the orientation, our staff will conduct a brief scuba equipment orientation, and professionally fit your personal equipment.

Gear You Need. For the SCUBA Diver Course, you'll need a mask, snorkel, fins, boots, and a weight belt.

1.877.SCUBA.USA is a SCUBA Learning Center and a retail dive shop. We offer the best equipment at affordable prices always available to our students.

RSVP required

results.description:
Join us as we hike a beautiful ridge high above Greenwood Lake.  Near the end, we'll have a LONG lake stop, great for those who want to "dip their toes."  (Swimming is officially not permitted.  But I don't play cop.)

Pace moderate.  Lots of small ups and downs.  

Distance: 10 miles +/-

Elevation: cumulative less than 1000 feet.

Stops: To enjoy the views/scenery/company/Chat with thru hikers...see Extra Bonus below.  

Non-Stop Hikers and Trail Runners: pick a different hike, please!

Extra Bonus: We will undoubtedly meet AT thru hikers coming north (on their way from Georgia to Maine) and stop to chat.  Consider bringing extra food/water to give them...they are usually very hungry and always very appreciative.

Dogs:  Very much so, but Ask!.  

Guests:  No, but Ask! We prefer all guests to join HVH.  

Finish: Hard to say, probably between 5 and 7:30.  If you have Saturday evening plans, we can't make any guarantees.

Shuttle:  This is a one-way hike.  We'll be setting up a shuttle.  

Bring the usual for a day hike:  Lunch/Snacks/2-3 quarts water minimum/Sunscreen/Bug Repellent/Extra clothing/Proper footwear/Backpack to put it all in/Small Towel etc. More suggestions in the About Pages.   

TRANSPORTATION:  Indicate your transportation situation in both the RSVP questions and in the comments.  Mention if you can offer a ride or need a ride (and from where.)  I  don't arrange carpools.  It's up to you.  There is a bus from Port Authority.  Ask.  

Meeting Spot: Park and Ride, 2 miles north of Tuxedo, NY, see above.  Warning: this may change.  I will send out changes and directions Friday evening, if any. 

RSVP Questions:   Be sure to answer them or you may be removed.  

 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 

Legal Stuff: You must read in order to attend!!!!

 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

This is not a commercial guide service or outfitter. The organizer(s) are not professional guides. They may or may not know what they are doing. They make no promises or representations as to your safety. They do not promise to wait for you or hold your hand. You agree not to hold the organizer(s), event host(s), and/or any other member responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at this event. You are responsible to research the trails, learn about the area, and decide for yourself what gear to bring. Suggestions made in the write up above may or may not be appropriate and many important items may not have been mentioned.


Further:

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the following:

You alone are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Hike. 10-12 mi. Long Lake Stop/Swim Op! Fit Beginners Welcome.

results.description: Not Suitable for beginners or slow hikers. Let’s have some fun and celebrate leader’s 53rnd birthday by doing leader‘s favorite activity this Sat. by going hiking. The hike will be 10 miles long depending on temperature and the leader’s energy level. This hike will be a typical Tuxedo hike with the usual assortment of hills, lakes, valleys, woods roads, etc. This hike won’t be run at a fast pace, but won’t be slow either. It will be at a moderate pace, and we will stop as needed. It could be a demanding hike for some. We will stop a reasonable number of times. If you are looking for a high intensity workout this is the wrong hike. Leader determines the pace, mileage number of stops, and duration of stops. If you want to run, do not come. Bring at least 3 quarts of water your lunch and wear hiking boots. If all goes well we will take the RD to the BD, the BD to the K, the K to the WB, the WB to the T, the T to the RD, and the RD to the parking lot. Rain cancels. No swimming and no dogs. Trans. 1C Tuxedo Orange CO. Bus Riders are always welcome. There is no need to let me know you are coming by bus. , but if you have any questions about the hike feel free to call or e-mail me. Bus riders take the 8:30 Short Line bus from PABT NY which Arr. 9:19.Buy a one way bus ticket. The short line ticket office is on the second floor of the North Building of the PABT. The bus usually leaves from gate 813. Drivers meet in in the commuter parking lot just passed the RR tracks on East Village road. . L: Joe Nigro[masked] (7:30-9:30 PM) [masked]

results.description:
We're going way up high for this one...!

Turtle Back has a rope obstacle course and a Zip Line that looks really cool.

The Adult Courses (approx. 35ft in height) offer 30 unique challenge elements with an average run time of 1 to 1.5 hours. The redesigned Zip Line measures over a football field in length and stands at approximately 40 feet.

I think companies usually use this as a team building exercise, but we can do it just because it looks freaking fun!

All participants must complete and print out the waiver form via the link below.

Waiver Form   Their Website

*****

Required Attire & Footwear:


Please remember the physical nature of the adventure.  Only guests who are wearing athletic sneakers will be allowed to participate. No sandals, flip flops, Toms, Crocs, Uggs, slip-ons, heeled boots, leather dress shoes or other footwear not intended for physical & athletic outdoor use will be permitted on the course (at the discretion of the course Supervisors).  

Clothing that a harness will not safely fit over will not be permitted on the course. 

Our expert adventure guides recommend that you bring a pair of slip resistant gloves (none are sold on premises).

*****

Pricing Details:

Cost per person not including tax: 
Rope course + Zip Line:  $32.
Rope course: $27.
Zip Line: $12.  

Please send $35 (tax included) to me ([masked]) via Venmo by 6/15 to fully secure your RSVP.  I will make a booking for the entire group.


If payment is not received by that time, you will be put on wait list and the spot given to the next available person.

I may also setup another session for additional participants at 11 am if there's enough interest.  This is not yet confirmed though.

*****

Carpool sheet

Updated 7/8/2015

*****

(Event date & details subject to change.)

We usually play one or two ~7 inning games. You can come for one or both. Teams are randomized before each. The lineups are locked at 13.

We play without a permit. We try to be aware of the field's availability but there is always a chance that we'll get kicked off by a permit-holder or that someone else will grab the field before us. (This has happened 2-3 times per year on average and we are usually able to relocate to a backup field 5-10 minutes away.)

Our annual costs:
meetup.com: $144
domain name: $15
clincher balls: $300

A suggested cash contribution of $15/year would be appreciated if you come regularly. (Electronic payment is easier). Or you can bring clincher balls (though we currently have a considerable stock remaining from last year).
results.name: Season 6

results.description:
About 15 miles, moderate pace, on the Bronx River Pathway from the Kensico Dam in Valhalla to Bronxville. From Bronxville hikers can choose to take the Metro-North train back to the city or continue walking about 3 miles to the 2 train at 241st Street. 

We will start by walking on top of the Kensico Dam, then head south 5 miles along the pathway to Hartsdale, then walk on suburban streets to Scarsdale, where we will pick up the pathway again and walk 4.6 miles to Bronxville. 

Bring snacks, water and lunch. We will take a lunch break in Hartsdale.  The hike will parallel the Metro-North Harlem Line, so there will be drop off points to catch the train at North White Plains, White Plains, Hartsdale, Scarsdale, Crestwood and Tuckahoe. 

Here is a link to the pathway description: Bronx River Pathway.

Meet: 9:30 a.m. at Grand Central Station at the Information Booth in the main lobby. We will take the 9:51 a.m. Metro-North Harlem Line train to Valhalla, $10.25 one way. The train will stop at 125th Street at 10:01 a.m. and at White Plains at 10:27 a.m., arriving at the Valhalla station at 10:34 a.m.  

Here is a link to the train schedule: Metro-North Harlem Line

Leader: Tom Bergen [masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.  

Shorewalkers events are free for members who have paid for an annual membership; we request a $3 donation from all others. Visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Bronx River: Kensico Dam to Bronxville

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class outdoors, at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructor, Marie-Elena Aruta. Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
Are you Looking to get fit?

Need to drop a few pounds?

Want to get in shape for the summer?

Try a FREE Boot Camp class at CrossFit Outbreak in Ft. Greene Park.


Our Boot Camp classes are designed to introduce you to CrossFit. We want to get you fit and healthy, challenge your mind and  body - we love to  MAKE FITNESS FUN.


The first class is free, each class after that is $15.00.


There is no obligation to join our gym outside of this class. 


The Exercises: CrossFit is a combination of strength, cardio, muscle endurance, flexibility, core, and functional movement patterns. You get EVERYTHING you need!


Time Efficient Training. Our classes are 60 minutes in length. We utilize the principle of muscle confusion. You will NEVER do the same workout twice! Why is this good? Because…your body will never adapt and you will keep on getting stronger and fitter.


Make sure to click on the link below to register for the class and sign our waiver form --->

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
